Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkDanny
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel ha ha for my daughter 21st birthday in feb of this year, we knew it wasn't going to be one of the top hotels but we thought the staff would at least say hello to you as you walk in, the breakfast was very '1st come you have food and table, if not you have the crumbs and you have no where to sit', and the table were so close to eachother no room to breath!! When we arrived we were told that we have to give a 20 deposit and i would get it back when we leave, when we checked out they told me that my £20 would be re-funded to my card within 1 working week. 7 WEEKS LATER I AM STILL CHASING MY £20, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!! The room was ok for what we paid but i did ask for 3 single beds and we got 1 double and 1 single, tv ok, beds didn't want to look under the sheets too much, bathroom ok, and close to bays water tube.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Palace but worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Licia_Miao
Reviews.Content: It's an average hotel in a very good position in London. The rooms are pretty tiny and for a twin we got just a queen bed to sleep in, which was just right to be placed between the walls (I don't even know how they would make the bed in the morning, there wasn't enough space!). Little bathroom too and no hairdryer. Our room was very close to the lift and it was quite noisy all night long, even in the morning when the customers would start to line up for breakfast. Good position in London though at an affordable price. The hotel is clean and the staff is nice and quick during breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “not value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dana_ver Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, walls with dirty marks, carpeting looks not very clean. very poor breakfast served in the basement. staff not friendly at all - no one is willing to assist and even do not bother to pretend to.

Reviews.Title: “When is a Palace NOT a Palace?”
Reviews.Author: professionalsnagger
Reviews.Content: Just got back from what was supposedly going to be a relaxing few days during half term. We booked this hotel as Bayswater has a good shopping centre with loads of pubs and restaurants and easy commuting into the City. However, the first night we had difficulty sleeping as our ensuite exractor fan would not turn off. In the morning we found silver fish on the bathroom floor. We complained at the reception and we agreed to a move whilst leaving our re-packed luggage at the reception for the day. Arriving back at about 6pm we were allocated another room, similar to our original room which we also described as shabby. The double bed springs had gone and there was a noticeable divett in the matress. The ensuite door had a hole in it. The wc cistern handle was heavily corroded and it was brown nearest to the cistern. We complained again and the receptionist visited the room. He agreed that it was poor and said that he was unable to move us all to another room as the hotel was full. However, the extractor fan did work! Breakfasts? Well, what can we say? Disorganised chaos! Watered down fruit juices, tinned fruit cocktail, sliced cheese, boiled eggs, toast and cheap cereal. We even had to ask for bowls and cutlery! 3 star? Not likely! 1 star may be! Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Daniela1610
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via despegar.com, and I must say I'm thoroughly disappointed. Small room (like a shoe box) it should have been en suite, but my bathroom was outside my bedroom. Too much money for such a hotel. 3 stars???? I don't know what criteria they follow to give this hotel 3 stars. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: brentofwisc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is better than average for a budget hotel in London. I wouldn't recommend it to people wanting a 5-star experience. But we had a full-sized bath tub in our room, with comfortable beds, and good ventilation. The room was also larger than I was expecting, we didn't have much of a problem with our small child wanting to run around. I would stay here as apposed to the other hotels in England that I have stayed at in the same price range. It was clean, the staff was nice and helpful and the area felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “totally disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jane l
Reviews.Content: We were only looking for somewhere basic and value for money for two nights, travelling as a family. However nothing prepared us for this horrible disgustingly dirty so called hotel. On arrival the reception area looks clean and welcoming, such a disappointment when we reached our room, badly planned very dirty a single glazed window that rattled,net curtains closer to black than white, damp on the glass. The beds had covers that belonged to a different era and would benefit from a proper wash. The so called bed settee had a cover on with black stains and no bedding was supplied until having a shouting match with the ignorant unhelpful muppet on the desk. Washed my hands and while drying them realised the towel was damp with blood stains on. The overall appearance of the room was very tatty and patched up, chipped walls, ceiling and doors all dirty. Breakfast was such an unhappy experience-no juice just very weak squash, cold toast, with cheese, eggs and jam all of which tastes as cheap and rubbery as possible. There is no room in the dining area to either get food onto your plate or to sit and eat. As a result of the free for all fight they inadequately named breakfast, mine ended up on the floor, we decided to go out to eat. The carpet on the stairs leading to the dining area was stained, dirty and threadbare. The whole experience was so grim and depressing and not sure what the people employed to clean do but it sure isn't doing their job well. Felt dreadful letting the children sleep in such a dirty place the beds were also so uncomfortable that I woke up hurting and sore. Could not wait to leave and wash as I felt so dirty would never stay there again. Please don't do it yourselves its a mystery how it remains open

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times in the past. Hotel then was great value a little run down but more than adequate for my needs after a late night in the west end namely a comfortable bed and hot water. Now the hotel has had a kind of makeover. Walls and doors have been painted and some of the furnishings have been upgraded. The price has also gone up considerably with very few decent deals being available on the various websites. The hotel is trying to place itself as something in the mid range. Whilst I would probably stay there again I would definitely not stay there with someone I care about as there are better options elsewhere available for the same sort of money. I stayed earlier this week with my cousin so we had a twin room. Around 3 am someone entered our room (although it was locked) and when I shouted they ran away down the corridor. Having got up and re locked the door (jamming a chair behind the door) I went back to sleep. In the morning I reported the incident to the receptionist who briefly feigned interest commenting that it was probably just another guest opening the wrong door!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad on the Wallet”
Reviews.Author: Lou G
Reviews.Content: This trip was a last minute thing and we were trying to make London as economical as possible which is why we chose this hotel. The rugs were in need of of cleaning, the bathroom in our room had recently been redone. The beds were not that comfortable but they were bearable. The staff were friendly and nice. It included breakfast which consisted of cereal, hard boiled eggs, fruit, bread, and cheese. One of the previous posts said that they could hear everything and I found this to be true. It is a short walk from the Bayswater Station of the Underground. Overall, it served the purpose we were looking for but I would probably stay elsewhere on my return.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, gas/toxins from bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: Holidayfrance
Reviews.Content: My sister, mum and i stayed here for two nights over the weekend ( 10-11-2011) and iwe had a room for three, which clearly was meant for two people, the three single beds were pushed together with no walking room between them... in the morning woke up to a horrible smell of gas/toxins coming from the bathroom. We opened the window and went down stairs to reception to investigate. The reception team were not very helpful and kept trying to pass the blame to the management team. We moved rooms , this time a double and a single was given, they hadnt even asked if two of us were prepared to share beds? This time there were no smells from the bathroom, but between the three of us, we were lucky if we had 3 hours sleep, we were on the road side, it was extremely noisy, shouting and screaming through the night. We asked to be refunded for at least one of the nights stay, due to discomfort, the gassy smells and the small room, but were told, we dont do refunds.... absolute disgrace, this should not be described as a three star hotel , no stars at all in our opinions

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin..”
Reviews.Author: StratfordonavonAndy
Reviews.Content: I booked a night here in a rush and didnt check reviews (stupid I know) until I'd booked the room. Horrified at what I saw tried to cancel. Went throughout with the stay which wasn't anywhere near as bad as expected. If you're looking for a large plush room with a comfy bed you're out of luck. If you need somewhere in a goo location to crash after a concert at wembley followed by a few beers it's just the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Worst night of my life!!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: Awful room , small and pokey, noise from other rooms and street. Bathroom way too small. Only saving grace Breakfast was ok. Very disapointing stay when we have stayed in many hotels on our journey from NewZealand. would not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: martyn536
Reviews.Content: Very basic, poor breakfast, TV only had ITV and that was very poor. Would not advise staying here unless it was last choice. Noisey at night.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere if you want value for money!”
Reviews.Author: heartlines
Reviews.Content: Positives - location, friendly enough service, quiet at night and they have an elevator. Negatives - expensive and hopeless wifi, terrible breakfast, hot water didn't work one night when i went to have a shower, tiny rooms and the first room we were in was certainly not clean. Probably could have dealt with all of the negatives if it wasn't so expensive for what you got. Won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “40th birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: Jmacdonald1972
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, hotel very cheap and great value for money. Breakfast bit poor but, the price of the room made up for the breakfast. Staff very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, central london, near transport”
Reviews.Author: 26andcounting
Reviews.Content: we got a cheap deal online, and were happy with what we got for what we paid. the room was very small. it would have been a small double, was infact a triple. the double bed was not a standard size, it was difficult to fit 2 ppl on it and the bed sheets were too big for it. there was no aircon so it did get a bit stuffy in such a small space with 3 ppl. good bathroom. overall a bit shabby and outdated but clean and good enough. we were just so pleased to be in that area. its a quiet area, a bit scruffy in places but not bad really. we chose it as this was soon after the rioting and we wanted to stay away from the troublesome areas. its a great location near kensington palace, hyde park etc. a 4 min walk away. and 3 tube stations close by. a taxi from heathrow airport was only 12 pounds! however we did organise an airport transfer through the hotel to get back to heathrow and it was 40 pounds with a random guy with an old van that drove very fast and badly and didnt speak english. dont get the airport transfer! wifi is available to buy for 7 pounds for 3 hours or you can use the pc in the foyer at 1 pound for 15 mins. a free buffet breakfast is included. but its not worth it. its terrible. it consisted of (and usually half of them would be empty) cold very thin toast orange cordial pretending to be juice hard boiled eggs cheese chunks a bowl of cucumber slices jam instant coffee and tea bags a bowl of yogurt corn flakes it all tasted quite bad. we kept trying to eat it and gave up most days because we didnt want to wait for the replacement bowls of eggs and slices of toast etc to come out of the kitchen. the cucumber and jam never seemed to run out. the staff varied. some were nice others seemed to be annoyed that you were interupting them. there was a big sign saying cafe in the lounge area. i looked closer and found an instant coffee manchine that you had to pay for. not really a cafe. it definaley felt like they had done everythng they could think of to cut costs, but i guess a safe place to sleep in london at a reasonable price is always going to be popular.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but get your own breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SRichards79
Reviews.Content: Stayed a single night here on business and was pleased with the room, small but clean. Staff seemed helpful - sorted out a iron for me quickly when I asked. What you get for the price seems very good. I know the breakfast is free but it is awful, I'd rather they charge a fiver and get some decent stuff in. The orange juice was incredibly watered down squash and god knows why there was a bowl of cucumber there. Just buy some croissant guys. Overall a good stay and a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “central London near transport and clean”
Reviews.Author: Teduk2001
Reviews.Content: This was a cheap stay from Internet. The hotel room was clean and the breakfast was continental and the stay was good value. The room was small and hot as it had no aircon. But very close to Bayswater and all the amenaties. I would use it again in central London.

Reviews.Title: “dont go!!”
Reviews.Author: adrianmason64
Reviews.Content: this is not a nice place to stay.it was cheap for london but that is no excuse for the lack of basic amenities.i had a single room that was so small i now no what its like to spend a couple of nights in wormwood scrubs! the shower and toilet were not even in the room,you had to go down about 20 stairs to get to them,very inconveniant when caught short at 3 in the morning.no shower gel or shampoo in the bathroom.i had to buy my own,never known that before! the breakfast was pathetic they didnt even have a toaster.no secure place for your luggage on day of checkout. the staff at reception were unhelpful.when i asked for shower gel the girl looked at me like i was mad! the windows in the room didnt open and it was 30 degrees outside.apart from that it was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: FinanceLady000
Reviews.Content: 3 carpenters from our company stayed at this hotel for two weeks when carrying out some work at a local museum. They stayed in a triple room, which was rather small and apparently very warm when all 3 were in the room. However the friendliness of the staff made up for the lack of space in the room, and they would definitely stay again - but they would try and get 2 twin rooms instead.

Reviews.Title: “Last resort.”
Reviews.Author: wpg01
Reviews.Content: London get's booked out and extremely expensive. This place is very hit and miss with large variation in quality from room to room. All quite tatty. Equally large variation in service at front desk (some staff try to be helpful, others are extremely rude and obnoxious). Only use this place as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, cheap”
Reviews.Author: knotsrocksanoatcakes
Reviews.Content: dirty, tiny room. not hoovered (fake eyelashes on the floor), toilet-showere on another floor to the room. breakfast inedible. cheap in every nasty sense.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in desperate need of a overhaul”
Reviews.Author: brokey1980
Reviews.Content: Four of us were booked into one room for four nights. The room was shocking!! Small, drabby, just run down in general. It is so bad we have booked another hotel. No refund possible apparently. I would rate this hotel more as a 1/2 star the 3. I would not recommend this place unless you are happy with hostel type environment.

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sorrentopete
Reviews.Content: 4 grown men sleeping in what seem to be childrens single beds in a room the size of a bird box. The beds are very uncomfortable, the room is very grimey. The breakfast is shockingly poor, no hot option! To summarise, the best part of this hotel is the door as you are leaving

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy and in need of an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: Freedomoffunk
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel. Wow, what a truly unique place. Filthy Walls and doors. Suspicious stains all over the place. Unwashed top bed cover. Breakfast was disgraceful, even the bread tasted cheap! Was woken up at 5:30am each day (and i am a heavy sleeper) by the noise of other guests. When a guest closed their bedroom door the whole place shook! Shocking! On the plus side, the bedsheets were clean and it is close to Hyde park. Having spent A LOT of time in London over the years I have never spent so much for so little. The owners should be ashamed that they don't invest any of their, rather sizeable, cash on a bit of an update. Avoid, you have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Avoid it!”
Reviews.Author: AstridInGeorgia
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some awful hotels in my time, but this is the worst one...bar none. We paid almost three hundred dollars for a triple room, and when we got there they gave us a tiny room with a lumpy full-sized bed and a twin bed the size of a small cot. The room was dusty and smelly. The bed covers and sheets looked dirty and like they had seen better days. To say that they TV in the room was tiny is an understatment, and it only had 5 channels, which were all snowy. But the worse part was that the room didn't have A/C, and it was stifling the whole time we were there. We had to sleep with the window open to withstand the heat. The beds were lumpy and uncomfortable. The full bed was tilted to one side, and after we checked why, we realized that the mattress was being held in place by cardboard and it had given way. They told us that they couldn't give us another room or transfer us to another hotel. They finally gave us another single room they size of a closet. The room had no bathroom, no lamps, the bed was hard and the curtain was torn. Also, there were no complimentary bottles of shampoo or conditioner, only two old bars of soap that were so old they were stuck to the sink. The shower head kept falling, and the toiled had trouble flushing. The elevators in the hotel are tiny, and the concierges at the front desk act like they wish they were not there. They were not rude, but not friendly either. I will never stay there again even if it was for free. Avoid it at all costs. You can find similar or better accomodations at a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Run down”
Reviews.Author: ShrewsburySkier
Reviews.Content: The room we were given in this hotel was desparately in need of redecoration - damp walls in the corner, broken doors, stained bed, and bed covers which needed throwing out 20 years ago! Having said that, the sheets were clean and so was the bathroom, although that is also due a refit very soon. Breakfast was terrible, no fresh fruit, yoghurt or juices. Just tinned fruit, cereals, toast and orange squash!! Â£99 for a twin room - not good value for money and we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back”
Reviews.Author: traveler187069
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a disappointment. We were given a room in the basement with a view to the laundry area of the staff. Besides this the room had a really unpleasant smell. Room was very tiny and not very aesthetic. The bathroom was the best part of the room and most important, it was not stinking as the rest of the room. However, there were only handsoap available, no shampoo let alone conditioner. Breakfast was good but really simple and basic one with toasts, coffee, tea, cereals, cheese, jam and honey. I would not call this place a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: mathelaci
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay 2 nights in this hotel. Luckily, because of a mistake with the booking I only stayed 1 night! Its clearly not a 3 star hotel. The toilet in the room was not cleaned! It still had the sh...t of the previous quest!! Everything was dirty and sticky! The bed was propped up with bits of wood! Wrote a complaint to lastminute.com about selling rooms at this hotel. I will never ever stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: doctorwhoBristol Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Was redirected to poor cousin hotel next door. Very Basic hotel. Value for money? Â£50/night for tight single room. Very dated and little musty. I just used it to sleep (2000-0645). Did not see breakfast lounge or any food. Toilet had single cake of used soap. I bought my own shower gel from shops near. Bad shower. Room was top floor, had a mini jungle growing outside window ledge. Lot of noise from school trip kids. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel, nothing bad to say about it really!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller3392
Reviews.Content: I liked it and don't know what the fuss Is all about!!!!

Reviews.Title: “this pace is great value for the money you pay in the area”
Reviews.Author: ilovebrusslman
Reviews.Content: i really liked it, i had previously read other people's comments and it put me off but when i needed a room in this area this was the only hotel that had rooms available because they are very big apparently. anyways, i think i got what i paid for and would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean rooms with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Businessboy009879
Reviews.Content: I was there for business for 5 nights, they gave me a good deal and they were very helpful with giving me directions and assisting me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Best price in the area.”
Reviews.Author: Italygirlgo
Reviews.Content: Hi, I came London for 2 night and was in the area of notting hill. I went to all hotels there and Pembridge hotel gave me the best price. It was very good I think as all the hotels in this area have same standards.

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: nancyajram
Reviews.Content: I stayed here togehter with my spouse and brother. The room was tiny, noisy, smelly and beds uncomrfotable. The sheets felt dirt and you don't want to take of your shoes in the room. The breakfast was poor. We even found an old Macdonald bag on the top of the wardrobe! Don't bother staying at this hotel. A clean hostel is a way more better choice than this. i casn't believe they even run this place.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty”
Reviews.Author: barnum42
Reviews.Content: I did not book into this hotel, but was sent there from it's sister hotel that appears to do a dishonest trade in taking bookings for a better quality venue then stuffing you in this dump. Tiny room (not that it needs to be big if all you plan to do is sleep there) Mattresses that must have been in use when JM Barrie wrote Peter Pan. Bathroom fittings that didn't Holes where there should not be holes. Lifts with a mind of their own as to when they can be bothered to take you to your floor of whether the doors will just shudder open and shut. Generally threadbare, tatty and worn down throughout. NO LUGGAGE ROOM. Most places have a secure room to place your luggage so you can deposit it before check-in or leave it whilst you enjoy your last day after check-out. Here they invite you to leave it in the open where any passing chav could relieve you of the problem of lugging it home. Single glazing so any passing noise in the night is crystal clear. Alarms that go off in the middle of the night (could have been one of the many visiting bands of students messing about with them ) The Continental Breakfast did fill a hole, but is nothing great - toast, jam, Asda value chocolate spread, boiled eggs, cheese slices, squash, Asda Value cerials, tea and Coffee.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: POTENTIAL CREDIT CARD FRAUD?”
Reviews.Author: KTnDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2011, and paid for it with a MasterCard. It was the ONLY place I used the card while on vacation to the UK. I was notified today that there was an attempted use of my card at department store in London for $2,600. It could be coincidence. But I am wondering if somehow hotel personnel are stealing card numbers? Given other feedback on this site about mis-billing, and a host of other unsavory behaviors as reported here, I wonder if someone should not report this to the authorities for investigation.

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap for a reason - Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: aardvark9A
Reviews.Content: Not much to say really - a low quality hotel. Room was OK, but bed wasn't very comfortable. It's was very noisy for most of the night & the breakfast isn't much to write home about. Don't book to stay here ... and if you have booked, I'd consider cutting your losses and staying somewhere else just so you get a decent night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: mcgonagall
Reviews.Content: we are a family of a mum, teenage daughter and child and we booked into a DIFFERENT hotel for one night. when we got there we where told they had booked us into a different hotel (this one) the room was miniscule, not too dirty but the tiles in the bath room where all broken and althought the hotel we booked into promised tv and toiletries, there was only a little bar of soap so we couldnt wash our hair. the tv was so fuzzy and made a horrible high pitch buzzing sound, and was unwatchable. the staff at the front desk demanded a credit card for a deposit, and after explaining for ages we DIDNT HAVE ONE they finally accepted cash.

Reviews.Title: “It's called a hotel but I think the 'S' is missing = hostel!!!”
Reviews.Author: karenridgway
Reviews.Content: We book this through 'Last minute.com' so didn't know the name of the hotel until it was booked and paid for! It was for a Theatre package and we chose the top price seats, only to be given bottom price hotel. We did wonder if the 'S' was missing as its more of a hostel than a hotel, don't expect shower gels, or shampoo as with other hotels! Dirty carpets, grimy bedcovers, and not much sleep. Rubbish location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever -and they charged my card 3 times for the pleasure, didn't respond to my complaint!!”
Reviews.Author: tallie_smith
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 3 friends. On arrival we were told the hotel was fully booked and told we had to move to another hotel -inconvenient as we had chosen this one for the location. So we were bundled in someone's car and taken to another hotel. Room was 4beds all pushed next to eachother dirty and dusty. When we went out, we were told to book a taxi through the hotel. It wasn't a licensed cab, when we were picked up the driver got out and jumped back behind the reception desk! At breakfast, there were no plates, one bowl between four of us, so we buttered our toast on the table and shared the two glasses that were provided between four of us. The breakfast room is a load of plastic chairs squashed into one room and everyone sharing tables trying to get a bit of room. We laughed it off and thought at least we had had a cheap night and didn't need to go back there -and a funny story about the disastrous experience! However I found out a couple of days later that my card had been charged 3 times! I got the money back through my bank, but the hotel were very unhelpful and to this day have not got back to me after me sending several complaint letters and calling them. I was simply told that I must have booked 3 rooms. I told them I hadn't, and asked if I had booked 3 rooms why they didn't tell me when I checked in? They said maybe there has been a mistake because my surname is Smith so they could have put other Smiths payments on my card!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: sarasatecarmen
Reviews.Content: Looks very nice on the site, but this is extremely misleading indeed. Cold room and bed. The room featured lots of glazing, but this was only single glazing, hence any heat from the rads escaped through the window. Could not sleep until 3.30 am, the cold came though the mattress, my legs cramped, and now have a dreadful backache. Unhelpful hotel staff did not want to acknowledge the issue. The breakfast was equally disappointing, Cheap Aldi/Lidl cereals on offer. Anaemic looking hard-boiled eggs, and 'orange juice' which was orange cordial watered down. Bread crumbled when tried to butter. Gotta be the worst ever.

Reviews.Title: “Pembrige, A LIAR AND DESHONEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SuzanaBrazil
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I booked 2 Twins En-suite (4Guests) for the last days of 2010 and after the inicial confirmation received in ours emails they sent another one to my cousinÂ´s canceling her reservatrion because of a crash in their system. I called by phone the hotel to know about mine and they confirmed the canceling of both because of the crash. They said they were going to send me one email as soon as possible with the cancelation and nothing would be charged. I traveled to London, booked another hotel and when I arrived back to Spain I checked my bank account and saw that they charged me for a service I didnÂ´t had! I called the hotel and spoke with Mr. Magid, a very rude man and not polite, and after 2 days of conversation he told me that he hadnÂ´t time to loose with me and how I donÂ´t have any proof of the canceling they have nothing to talk with me anymore! ItÂ´s unbelievable. IÂ´m an old lady and my bank is going to solve this problem for me. Keep away from Pembridge Palace Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Grimy, cheap but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTeal
Reviews.Content: Had this been a Youth Hostel I would have little to complain about. We enjoyed a fantastic show in London, then decided rather than travel back to Oxford in the night to stay at a three-star value hotel. It simply IS NOT 3 * - I'd love to know HOW this is measured, and by whom. The Â£170 for a quad room is not overly expensive, but it was grimy, i could lay in bed and touch the ceiling, which had very nasty dirty marks on it, and my 15 year old daughter has bed bug bites and is distressed. Go to London, expect to spend a good deal, but if you want to sleep with a degree of comfort DON"T think about this messy, rather nasty joint.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST SERVICE AMONGST LONDON HOTELS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lady025
Reviews.Content: The conditions were to say the least appalling, and apparently the management are not great fans of cleanliness since they adamantly refuse to provide any shampoos and shower gels, and thought a pitiful bar of smelly soap would suffice for three people. The reception find themselves unable to take ANY responsibility and could not provide any safe deposit box. Our group was charged for allegedly destroyed towels but when we asked to examine the damage, we were as usual referred to the manager who was ALWAYS conspicuously absent. Despite the seriousness of the argument, the silly ironic smile would not leave the receptionist's face making us doubt his intelligence but at least providing us with a plausible reason why someone would want to work in a place like that! We would also recommend preparing more toast for the already pathetic breakfast as two small racks are not nearly enough for a room of hungry people with not much else to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting - not worth a penny!!”
Reviews.Author: tinks53
Reviews.Content: Your staff could hardly speak English, so very unhelpful - The rooms were absolutely disgusting, carpets filthy!! And no bigger than a closet!! Breakfast was terrible - no forks no spoons no plates. We were terribly misinformed by the on line booking company, Bookings.Com - I suggest you never book through this company.

Reviews.Title: “Too cold to sleep and bad value”
Reviews.Author: SteliosUk
Reviews.Content: I have one thing to say about this hotel if you bring a woolly hat and thermal underwear you may just about be able to sleep. This hotel was freezing. Choose a travelodge or something.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel, even among "tourist class" properties...look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: KTnDC
Reviews.Content: I write this knowing that this was an less expensive by London standards, at about $150/night at the current currency conversion. The hotel may be less expensive than some, but it is not a good value for what you spend. CONS: The mattresses were older than I am (and I'm no spring chicken); you had to sleep in the large crevice left in the mattress by all the guests before you, and endure a night of springs in your vertebrae. The room was EXCEPTIONALLY small - we had to store one of our two suitcases in the bathroom because there was no room for it anywhere else. The hallways are about 15 years overdue for maintenance, and I'm sure there's not a single wooden floor board that does not squeel like a stuck pig when stepped upon. That means you WILL here every footstep made by your upstairs neighbors and those in your hallway. Breakfast was included, but don't expect anything beyond coffee, hardboiled eggs, cold pre-made toast, and cereal. Elevator was a death trap, and an exceedingly slow one at that. It shook, rattled, jerked, and moaned its way at a leisurely pace, and seemed to choose when and where it would respond to a call for a lift according to its own whims. And then there were the pillows. Wow, were these things bad. A sheet of standard office paper is considerably thicker and plusher. There's a sign in each room that says "Please contact the front desk should you desire extra pillows or sheets." I asked for extra pillows, but never received any, nor did I receive any explanation why I didn't get them. PROS: Convenient location to the Tube, some decent restaurants nearby, pretty convenient location to Hyde Park and West-End points of interest. And even if the front desk was unable to deliver on any requests (e.g., extra pillows), they were always very kind to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Hosts aren't important”
Reviews.Author: danielabetancourt58
Reviews.Content: The prices could be better than in the other hotels. The location could be better than in the other hotels. But, the attention is even wors thanwhat you can receive in the other hotels. We went for 6 nights, we were 5, 3 adults and 2 teenagers. The breakfast is really basic, but the problem really is in the treat they gave us. They believed we were liers and thieves. They closed our room because we hadnt gave the money, eventhough they had the credit card as warrantied. We hadnt a telephone, neather a remote control and the explanation they gave us, was that we were in high attendance season and that we had to understand them. You can come to this place if you dont like being well treated, having a good breakfast, and feeling as home.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE! read this!”
Reviews.Author: nuirat
Reviews.Content: So, me and my boyfriend travelled to London for some job interviews and we wanted to stay at a cheap yet nice place. this is NOT it! - we booked a double room.. but when we got there they had given us a twin room.. we asked to change, and we went to a room in the basement. - the room was just terrible, dirty, really old, etc.. the walls had moisture all over it, some had already loose some paint.. really bad.. - the room was small, REALLY small! like, if i opened up my bag the bathroom door wouldn't open.. and you had no more than 10cms between the bed and the walls.. so you had to enter bed from its bottom,, - the bathroom was clean BUT it had used soaps and one used towel. Oh yes, and we had to ask towels because they forgot to give us. - they don't change the sheets. we were there for 4 nights and on the first night we got the sheet dirty and they didnt change it until the last day although I ASKED THEM to change it before.. - we forgot to bring adapters and we went to the reception to ask for one, and they gave us a stick that is used to mix sugar on your coffee and said to stick it to the electricity socket and then force it because it would work that way.. SERIOUSLY? - we bought 1h of internet (which is 3Â£!!!) but it didnt work from our room since it was on the basement.. and we had to argue for them to give us our money back - you do not have fresh bread in breakfeast.. you can make toasts and you have cheese...and that's about it.. in the end, if we hadn't paid in advance, we would not sleep there at all. Ask to see your room before you pay at least! when I read the comments here I thought "so its cheap, its not perfect but I think it will be good enough" - IT'S NOT! i am sure that there are plenty of other hotels for the same price where you have a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel To Avoid”
Reviews.Author: consted
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in room G05 and we can say this is one of the worst hotels we've ever stayed at during our travels in Europe or back home in the US. Our ground floor room had worn carpets and a musty smell, as if the rugs had gotten wet and had not properly dried. The bed covers were stained and worn and on my wifes side of the bed, she complained one of the mattress springs seemed to be protruding. One wall next to the bed had small dog or cat foot prints. The room had a small desk but only one electrical outlet and no electrical outlets in the bathroom. There was also no telephone in the room. Wi fi access is avaiable if you are willing to shell out 3 or 6 British pounds an hour while accessing the internet in the hotel lobby. I resorted to using the Wi fi at the Starbucks cafe a few blocks away. I paid for the five pound Starbucks card and had unlimited Wi fi access (as long as the Starbucks was open anyway). One advantage to this hotel is it's relative closeness to Hyde Park, Basewater train station and many restaurants and souvenior shops just a block away. However; my wife and I spent as much time as possible away from the hotel since our room was so depressing. If you have to stay here, I suggest you ask to see the specific room you will be staying in before you pay,( by all means avoid room G05). By the way, you pay in full up front at this hotel, so avoid my mistake and look at the room before you hand over your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Booking”
Reviews.Author: Locky123
Reviews.Content: They lost the booking after an email had been sent confirming that it was all done and the money was taken out of the visa card. Very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, shabby, noisy, unhelpful staff, very small rooms, etc. etc.”
Reviews.Author: Ian_and_Lisa_1966
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay in a place that is only just step up from a hostel - then this is the place for you. The rooms are incredibly small. The decour is a throwback to an earlier age, for example each curtain when pulled across had a good 30cm depth difference! The beds had old blankets on them which matched very nicely with the old wardrobe and desk which had what can only be described as a school chair under it. We went to ask for more pillows at which point the reception staff said that they did not have any but he very helpfully brought out two pillows but told us that they were dirty but that we could use them anyway !! after a couple of bewildering minutes they did finally relent to give us a couple of pillowcases as well. The carpets were worn, the lock was broken on our daughters window, there were lots of ladybirds inside on the curtains and the only place to put any normal possessions was on the floor by the bed. Lights over the bed did not work in our daughters room. Bathroom was so small that the door had to open outwards across the main door which made it very difficult going in and out. Floorboards creaked every time you walked anywhere. Walls were also marked and dirty. Towels were very thin, hard, old and greyish, water did not work properly as it kept running out. HOWEVER the main problem was the noise at night - children running up and down, babies crying, adults talking loudly and the doors banging/creaking. The walls are very thin and as the doors do not fit properly it felt like you were in the same room as everyone else. We complained about the noise and the room and after a discussion with the reception desk we were offered a basement room which if you are claustrophobic would make you decidedly uneasy. We were booked for three nights, but we only lasted for one, we unfortunately left a dress behind, but when we phoned the hotel after they were not at all helpful and couldn't tell us if we would get the dress back. In short !! If you book and stay at this hotel - you would be mad.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful, empty whisky and wine bottles under bed along with months of dirt.”
Reviews.Author: RindaO
Reviews.Content: Had booked one double and one triple(three single beds). On arrival given one very dirty small double, one double bed and one single in other room. Staff changed family room for three singles in basement. After one night in double requested a quieter room , also changed for us. The first night we spent in a double room on the first floor, bathroom filthy, silacone around bath ,black, lever on taps fell off and bruised my foot, electric socket in room did not work, could not leave window open at night , as window opened upwards, providing zero security, no air conditioning and balcony shared by others who were outside our window smoking. Our second night room had empty bottles under the bed along with a broked wooden slat also lying under bed, behind headboard large hole in wall with exposed wiring and what must be months of dirt. Family room was in basement, carpets dirty, shower room not too dirty. Breakfast , tined fruit, waterer down orange coloured juice, milk,hard boiled eggs, cold toast , cheese and cereal. One microwave for DIY cheese on toast! Cafe facilities, were coffee machine and cold water from the tap, small machine selling some cold drinks and sweets. I personally woul not recommend this hotel , the photographs shown are very misleading . Staff gave in to my requests for change of rooms reluctently.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING, DIRTY DISGRACE WITH RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: YasminAlTellawy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace. I checked into a room that had smoothie spilt in the carpet, and smelt disgusting. Then, the noise from others in the hotel kicked off early evening and you can hear every noise possible from other guests and that is not what I want to hear. In complaining I got nowhere. I had to leave after midnight on the day I checked in due to the noise and the stuffy smelly rooms. I was told it would be no problem to get a refund, I had to deal with the manager the next day. i called the manager twice a day to never get anyone, to not get a reply to my letters, calls, emails. I got response from an endless amount of rude foreigners who worked at the hotel. This place is shameful and I advise people to not waste their money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: riversedge2004
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that after reading the mixed reviews I wasn't quite sure what to expect when I booked this hotel. I booked a double room for 1 night for me and my fiance because we were going the the Kings of Leon concert in Hyde park. When we arrived I handed the receptionist a print out of our reservation and she quickly gave us our room card/key, so book in was quick and easy, when we got to our room we were happy to see we had a triple room with a double bed and a single bed, that we were given for no extra charge, The room was clean and the en-suite bathroom was freshly cleaned and spotless.. It had clean towels and the shower was very powerful. There was a small portable TV that didn't have many channels but was fine. The bed was very comfy and I had a great night sleep with no noise. We were on the 3rd floor and the bars on the window did not bother me at all. The room was clean and tidy and even though is wasn't immaculate and didn't have everything brand new, it was perfectly fine. Breakfast the next day was ok, you had a selection of toast, jam, chocolate spread, eggs,cereal,fruit salad,etc. To me, considering the Â£60 we paid for both of us, I think the hotel was great value, and I'm a bit confused as to why it has such bad reviews, For the price of the rooms your not going to get luxury, and the fact breakfast is included in the price is a bonus, I would definately stay at this hotel again and the location is also excellent. Maybe some of the other rooms are in different condition?, but the room we had, 311, was clean and spacious and fine for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Nasty”
Reviews.Author: JanePerth_Australia
Reviews.Content: Having travelled for 7 weeks, we had stayed in many hotels and this one stood out as particularly grotty. The first room we were put in had old red carpet which was badly in need of replacement or cleaning with black spills over them and the bedcovers also looked dirty and worn. There were also cigarette burns in the desk top. The room was so small we couldn't open our suitcases. Breakfast was the meanest we have seen with thin toast and homebrand cereal and watery tinned fruit. YUK.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible awful”
Reviews.Author: SJR17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night only (thankfully) in june 2010, got a double basement room for Â£65. Room was tiny, dark (had bars over the windows), bedcover was like some stained 1950's throwback. Put the shower on - went in 5 mins later and it was blocked and overflowing with others peoples hair. Disgusting. Breakfast was dilute orange and a fight over infrequent racks of toast! It might be cheap but there are better places!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Heather027
Reviews.Content: 1. Receptionist very busy but remained polite, reception area warm and welcoming; 2. Bathroom small but very clean recently referbished; 3. Double bedroom small, however the bed was very comfortable and the sheets were clean; 4. Breakfast was adiquate for me however my husband could have done with more of a choice;

Reviews.Title: “Great, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: PantsCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 5-7th June for the Rage Factor gig in Finsbury Park. Our room was a decent size (one double bed and a single, even tho we only paid for a double room) and very clean, looked like it had been recently refurbished. Breakfast wasn't great which was a disappointment, just toast (which disappeared like gold dust when it was brought out) and boiled eggs. Oh well, there's a great pub around the corner (Prince Edward) that had a good menu! It was very easy to find in a great location, just round the corner from Bayswater or Queensway; lots of bars, restaurants etc nearby. Only problem with the room was the thin walls; were woken up a few times in the night when the upstairs room flushed their loo. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nickrailroad
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews of this hotel and as you do, only come out thinking of the bad ones. If you are going to be staying in London....how much time are you going to spend in your hotel? There is so much to do, and I would presume you would have plans already set. The Pembridge is perfect. Check in was very quick, the room was clean, bathroom very clean and I had a good nights sleep. Woke up in the morning, had a shower and checked out for my day in London. Where else 2 minutes from tube and Hyde Park could you get a hotel for Â£49 for a double room? This was just what I wanted, a bed and a shower.

Reviews.Title: “the price was great, location is great the room was fine.”
Reviews.Author: giantcuttlefish
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for three nights while in London visiting friends and sight seeing in Feb 2010. After I spent days searching the net I think we got the cheapest priced hotel for that area and for the price I paid I thought it was fine. The room was small, but I had expected that, it was clean enough, the bathroom looked like it was new and the water was nice and hot. The heating was fine I was never uncomfortable and we both slept very well there. As for breakfast I thought it was good value (again I wasnâ€™t really expecting much after all the comments on Tripadvisor) heaps of toast, cheese and boiled eggs, some canned fruit, tea coffee and juice. If you are just looking for a cheap basic room in a good location then this is the place. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell!”
Reviews.Author: joban_10
Reviews.Content: Went overnight to watch a London show, booked hotel as it looks lovely online. It is far from what the pictures show on their website, maybe its of another hotel. Fire alarm went of twice during early hours of 5am! Cracks and holes in the wall of which i have photograpic evidence! Grotty bathroom, no plug in bath. Huge piles of dust everywhere. What looked like pubic hair on our sheets, felt very dirty in the morning. T.V. was blurry! Curtains were not hung properly. Drawings on wall, head board was hanging off. Did ask to move and was refused! .. Could not leave as we had pre-paid! ... Would not recommend it! Not a nice hotel for an anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY here”
Reviews.Author: vacationtraveler55
Reviews.Content: we were stuck in Germany and could not make it to London due to the volcano. We immediately started calling for travel and to cancel this 3 night stay. It took over 24 hours to contact. We were told that we had to ALSO give them notice via e-mail. LUCKILY, we could get access to a computer and did what was asked. We gave them plenty of notice but they still refused to credit anything (even ONE day) for the stay. This in spite of no vacancy when we would call to check -- even late at night. After reading other reviews and our experience -- I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “This is your ideal place if you're not too picky!”
Reviews.Author: Langham79
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel during the Easter break. When walking into the grand reception we thought that we had walked into the wrong hotel! We were very amazed! Check-in was a very quick process, the standard of the room met our expectations as we are not at all picky and it was worth our money. The location of course as others have said is excellent, our room was also facing the beautiful garden! We enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would recommend this to a friend but not someone who is very picky!!

Reviews.Title: “vile-worst hotel ever had to stay in!!!avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: miniBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Dirty,old,vile hotel.DO NOT BOOK SINGLE BASIC!...Unless you like the thought of being in a prison cell with no bathroom,no tv no kettle,no room for a suitcase and the windows nailed shut! Would not recommend this hotel to anyone,how they have the nerve to name it a palace is beyond me!! Noisy,full of strange groups of people running up and down the corridors all night! Didnt even bother with breakfast!Worst hotel iv ever had to stay in!I even upgraded my room and it was still terrible,very bad value for money...they should pay thier customers to stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about the 3 star bit - maybe no stars”
Reviews.Author: Inghie
Reviews.Content: Based on that the fact that I was looking for a budget hotel, when I saw 3 stars, I was thankful. However, when I arrived at the door steps of the Hotel, I was very disappointed. We all were. Check in was a quick process yes, however the hallways to the room has this weird smell, not a pleasant one. Got to the room only to see dirty walls, stained sheets, a dusty wardrobe, torn blankets, coarse, discoloured towels that were apparently SUPPOSED to be white and a bed that had a frame that was moving apart. The bathroom was the most presentable part of the room, but that too had little pick ups. Last but not least, along the stairway in the room, there is a hole in the wall, and next to it is a crack as well. Breakfast was not as continental as we expected so we didn't have it. This definitely is a 4 thumbs down and we would not recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. Pembridge Palace, you have a prime location, however you need to have a look at what you are offering to your customers so that you can keep them. Excellent marketing strategy, you definitely caught us.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Filthy Place”
Reviews.Author: TuckerTTucker_592
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last night from the outside it looks bad when you go intothe lobby it doesn't look to bad I was given room B13 on entering the room it was dark dingy and damp the carpet had Staines on and the bed had chewing gum stuck to the sheets. I went to open the window which was coverd in cob webs and fag butts. So I went to the pub for the night. On returning I wanted a cup of tea before bed which was a struggle as there is no kettle in rooms went to reception to be told I had to bye a tea for 50p. Breakfast was crap cheep cornflakes and waterd down orange juice. I was suppossed to be staying there tonight but booked out when I found iv been bitten by flies. DIRTY PLACE SHOLUD BE SHUT DOWN

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Palace”
Reviews.Author: m_alkademi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pembridge Palace Hotel in March 2010 in a quad en-suite room with a couple of friends. When we first we walked into the reception we were amazed to find the grand style given to it, it was beyond our expectations. The receptionist was very friendly, did not take long to check us in and gave us all the information necessary. The room was averge, neither was bad or too good, its just fine for a couple nights in London. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would recommend this to anyone, and if I ever intend to go back to London, I will definitley reserve at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book into this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Disgruntled069
Reviews.Content: The reception area wasn't too bad, which lulls you into a false sense of security. The rooms were absolutely disgusting. The beds looked like the bedding hadn't been changed in months! The carpet looked as though it should have been thrown out about 5 years ago. Paint was coming off the walls and woodwork and the rooms were damp. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy

Reviews.Title: “great location and cheaper than the ones around”
Reviews.Author: markus05
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel very late and the offered me a very good deal compared to the ones arounf the same area. it was only minutes away from hyde park as well which was very good after a long day of meetings.

Reviews.Title: “I cried when I saw our room!!”
Reviews.Author: goolitonhertravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this awful hotel. I needed somewhere last minute and didn't want to pay over the odds. I was horrified when we got to the room and even cried when I saw how grubby the place was. I slept with my own towel on the pillow as it was so uncomfortable. The beds looked like they had been pulled out of a skip and were dirty under the vallance. There were also no first aid facilities, I hit my head and my husband asked for ice, which they couldn't give us, instead they produced a half empty old bottle of Fanta, which was sticky, from a freezer and expected me to put it on my head! Overall, a badly run hotel with not redeeming features. Please don't stay at this hotel!!!! I don't mind a basic, no frills kind of place but this is DIRTY and would be a hazard to your health!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away !!”
Reviews.Author: BarryBarrytown
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the hotel is its location, however it is very close to a drop in/homeless hostel. We are two girls who were very tired when we arrived, The guys at reception were creepy, the first room they showed us to had a large window which only one curtain actually fitted, It was no bigger than a shoebox with no nets at the windows so no privacy, tv had no ariel, and we itched before we even took our coats off!! Next room was slightly bigger with nice stained walls and a door that had been kicked in so no chance of locking. We rang recpetion to ask them to look at it, they said we would have to change again. The rooms have no hairdryer, kettle, actually they have less than the bare minimum. Horrendous the type of place dodgy pornos are made in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A Victorian hotel last renovated in the Victorian times?”
Reviews.Author: MariaKat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one or two nights after moving to London for a few months on a very short notice. After a couple of nights I switched elsewhere. This hotel is in pretty bad condition and badly in need of renovation. The room was cold and I could hear every noise coming from the near-by rooms. Breakfast was pretty bad, too (worst coffee I've ever had). The guy at reception was sleezy. The area is very nice and charming though, but I'd choose another hotel in the area. To be fair though, for this low price, you shouldn't expect too much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, no value at all”
Reviews.Author: KirkSweden
Reviews.Content: My holiday ws ruined bec of my stay at this hotel. I have itch all over my body. I have to cont mey tretment as it is the most uncomfotable. got the disease hope it will go away. i havent got a proper sleep. the bed hav crawling insects in the hotel. i told staff but no help. just said yes but no help given to me. and they mistake charge my card until now they havent return my money. TO MANAGEMNT: I BEG please do somting. dont make promises to your guest and be honesst with your servce

Reviews.Title: “I wasnt expecting luxury for the price but WOW I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: illadviseyou
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night and that was too many!! Not only was the paint peeling off the walls and the curtains falling down but the walls next to the bed were grubby, the bathroom put me off and the floor boards creaked louder than a thousand trumpets when someone walked past our bedroom. Not only is it poorly taken after but they don't have anything! When we wanted a bottle of wine, not a corkscrew was to be found in the place. Poor show for a hotel in such a nice part of London. Needless to say I didn't stay for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Booking Information”
Reviews.Author: yanopugoy
Reviews.Content: I booked a smoking room in this hotel with expedia. However, upon check-in, I was informed that the entire hotel was non-smoking, and that there would be a charge of 100GBP if the guests would smoke in the rooms. I am very disappointed with the misleading booking information, as I could have booked another hotel with a real smoking room. Had I known that the hotel was non-smoking, I would have booked another one. I would have overlooked the small, dreary room or the meager breakfast, given that the room rate really was cheap. But I cannot get over blatantly misleading potential customers through false advertising. Beware booking this hotel as you may not get what you really expect.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this Hotel, for you own Health and Safety!”
Reviews.Author: VasTim
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thinking it looked like a decent 3 star hotel in a posh area in London. BIG MISTAKE. The rooms are tiny, and smelly. They didn't change the sheets and towels from the people that stayed in the room before us, and the service was extremely slow and the people that own it just don't care. It is illegal to have a hotel like that open where the standards of hygiene are worse that in a third world country! I am looking to report this hotel to the appropriate organisation.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay at Pembridge Palace”
Reviews.Author: BethanyW
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay at Pembridge Palace for 5 nights but moved out after 12 hours. The place is filthy with no hot water. Why is it allowed to remain open?

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Vikki100
Reviews.Content: The Pembridge Hotel is the worst value for money hotel i have ever stayed in. The location is great but that is the only good thing about it. The rooms are awful, and literally the size of the bed and very old fashioned and not decorated. Our room was in the basement next to the laundry room, it was one of the worst nights sleep i have ever had in a hotel. On top of this in the morning the breakfast room was far too small for the amount of visitors. people were standing up eating breakfast and microwaving their coffee as it was cold. For Â£100 it was a total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: clare6Paris
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it can be really difficult to find decent accomodation in London which is not toom expensive. The hotel is clean enough, nice and location is great, only 5-10 minutes from the closest tube station or few minute walk to Portobello Road in Nothing Hill and Kensington Gardens. In my opinion it's value for the money that also includes a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “If the price is low, then it's ok, but only then!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth62
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay the night before we arrived and therefore got a very good price. It was a last minute trip so we said "good location and a three star hotel at low rate, preferably with breakfast included" And that's what we got. Well, I don't know about three star it could also have been a two star. i think it depends on what room you get! We got a pretty nice room when we arrived late and we really wondered what all bad reviews where about. Well, we found out when we got to bed - it was like sleeping on the floor, and when we tried to get the shower on - it was almost impossible to turn it on and once we got it turned on it did'nt get off! So, with a smile on our lips we got to shange to another room with a brand new shower! Beside this little insidence (the bed was fixed with extra plankets under the sheet) we think we could recomend it but only if you don't pay to much! Location is great and the breakfast ok. Couple from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel that I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: EmilyJaneBmth
Reviews.Content: I can not believe how horrible this hotel is. Here is my list: The room was tiny, there was no space to put anything; the wardrobe was too small, I couldn't even fit my bag in it; there was only one bedside table even though it was a double room, there was only one flat pillow each and a sheet with a blanket that kept sliding off the bed; the light bulb was hanging out of the broken ceiling light fitting, which had no cover; the bathroom was so small you had to walk in sideways; there was no soundproofing between the rooms so you could hear people in the next room talking; the floorboards above us and on our level creaked incredibly loudly to the point I kept expecting to find someone in our room; if someone in another room used their bathroom you could hear as the pipes were running through our room; communual doors were left to slam, waking us up; there was no hot water for a shower; we had to shut our window because of people smoking below our window outside; the stairwells were disgustingly dirty; there was part of a banister missing in one of the stair wells; we were disturbed by a cleaner knocking on our door 45mins before checkout time. I managed about 5 hours sleep in this incredibly noisy, dirty, uncomfortable, cramped hotel. Not at all the refreshing break I had planned. I would of had far more sleep staying at home with the children!! Please never ever go to this horrible hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy dirty, extremely poor hotel. The owner is dishonest.”
Reviews.Author: Travel2009016
Reviews.Content: We were travelling in Norway and had booked an 8 night stay (Saturday through the following Sunday nights) in this hotel. Our plans changed to leave London for two nights and I contacted Hotels.com to cancel our stay on Friday and Saturday, returning on Sunday night. We were told that this could be done at the hotel upon our arrival. The owner informed me that, with five full days notice, the two night cancellation was not a problem and that we could leave one piece of luggage in the hotel lobby during our absence. We departed on Friday, returning the key card for our room. We returned on Sunday and checked out on Monday. Upon checkout the owner went back on his word and refused to refund us for the two nights we had cencelled. He said that we may be able to get a refund through Hotels.com. We had no time to argue because we had to catch a plane at LHR. I am amazed that this hotel has a three-star rating as the place is unfit for habitation. Check out my pictures and you be the judge. This hotel would surely fail most all requirements of the Canadian Hotel Association Standards in terms of health and safety, services and customer relations. I most strongly discourage people for using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Crap!!!!”
Reviews.Author: deejayBournemouth
Reviews.Content: The price and location seemed good but it was not worth it. The room was tiny with there not being enough space for 2 people to move around without one going and standing in the toilet. The bed had one flat pillow each a sheet and dirty blanket. The en-suite was also small and you had to walk in sideways past the sink to get in. The walls between the rooms were obviously very thin as you could hear people having a normal conversation in the next room. You can hear people all night, pipes clanking, floorboards squeaking, doors banging. The stairways were disgustingly dirty with months of dust lying around. The one we went down had a broken banister which would have been dangerous for young children. In the morning there was no hot water for a shower and when we mentioned this to reception they seemed very disinterested and suggested we washed in the sink. Not the hotel experience we were really looking for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our worst hotelexperience ever”
Reviews.Author: Mirnth
Reviews.Content: Dirty filthy carpet, small room, too little wardrobe and worst of all, the beds were lousy, filthy, a flat pillow and you only had an old seamy blanket to take over you. Not worthy to be called beds as they were unfit to sleep in. You can hear whatever your neighbour says or do in the next room. The toilet did not flush and the sewer was stopped so there was water in the sink all day. No internet connection was available although it is promised on the website for the hotel. All in all: Disgusting. Don't ever go there.

Reviews.Title: “Please, please stay away!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ANDY978
Reviews.Content: Please PLEASE don't stay there. My husband booked this hotel for its location if nothing else, as we only needed a bed to sleep on for one night. I had very low expectations, and still this hotel (it doesn't even merit the title of a "hotel") managed to disappoint and disgust me. I've been to over a hundred hotels and hostels and inns in my lifetime so that's saying something. I suspect the place got a 3-star rating because the owner (cleverly) invested all their resources in the lobby area, because I cannot imagine how it could have gotten the rating with its old, grubby rooms. So, here's the list: tiny room, broken window, tiny TV with poor reception, could barely stand in the bathroom (was actually surprised the shower had hot water), disgusting mattress and blankets (wondered if they had ever been washed in their long lifetime), crappy breakfast (toast, basic cornflakes, boiled eggs and bad coffee) At first, the toilet wouldn't flush, so we told reception on our way out to eat dinner. I guess, looking at some of the other reviews, we're actually lucky they actually fixed it. My husband tried to make a call using the hotel phone but it wouldn't work, so he called to ask reception and they actually told us "that service is no longer available, because some of the other guests had misused that service", whatever that means. Also, we got a call from reception to come down, because they'd charged our hotel stay to somebody else's credit card, which is a totally different and serious problem as it really got me worried about the safety of our credit card information as well. The misery of the hotel followed me even after I checked out and left, because I fell sick a couple of hours after eating the crappy breakfast, which I strongly suspect was from milk that had gone bad, because toast and milk at the hotel was the only thing I'd eaten that morning. In short, this place has NOTHING to offer in terms of cleanliness, security, comfort, health and even location (you can easily find other much better accommodations at similar distances from the tube station; I know because I've stayed in one, but I won't mention the name).

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: Genie18
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews after booking the hotel through Lastminute.com and so was dreading staying there (really wish I'd read the reviews first). I wasn't expecting The Ritz and said to my Mother "It's just a bed for a couple of nights, it can't be that bad". How wrong I was! It was awful....The room was tiny and the walls were filthy. as previously stated, there are no tea/coffee making facilities which to me is a basic requirement. The carpet was thread bare and dirty. I dreaded going back to the hotel each night as it's so gloomy and you wake up feeling dirty. The only positive thing I have to say about it was that the lift works! I've stayed in basic accomodation before but this was by far my worst experience and would urge anyone to stay elsewhere if possible.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing stay,take your own plug!”
Reviews.Author: june008
Reviews.Content: We werent expecting anything spectacular but after being quite pleased that we actually had a bathtub as well as a shower we were somewhat annoyed to find there was no plug for either the bath or the washbasin,After asking at reception we were told to ask housekeeping the following day which when we did we were told they didnt have any, and to have a shower instead.There are no tea making facilities in the room and although some at reception,these are not free.Room was very small and quite grubby.I have to add that I actually booked the hotel Reem next door but on arrival was told we were being moved to its sister hotel , the Pembridge Palace which was 'better' ,if this was the case then Reem must have been very poor.The hotels obviously move guests between the two of them so there is no guarantee where you will be staying

Reviews.Title: “simply awful.”
Reviews.Author: crazykidIreland
Reviews.Content: in short, i cannot believe this is a 3 star hotel. upon arrival, the staff were unfriendly and very slow at getting us our room key. we had booked a double room online, only to be told when we arrived that no double rooms were available! the room we stayed in felt dirty and it felt like the walls were made of cardboard - we could hear noise of snoring, talking, showering and using the bathroom from rooms above, below and beside our own. beds were extremely uncomfortable. we generally felt uneasy about the area as it seemed unsafe. at times, we even felt uneasy in the hotel. it was however located very close to bayswater tube station so it was handy enough for travelling into central london. we will not be staying here again and would not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Sophiemugs
Reviews.Content: I have never been so disgusted by a hotel. We were barely acknowledged as we checked in, we asked for a double room and got a twin. The rooms were tiny and offered no facilities; tv did not work, no bulbs in bedside lamps, no kettle or glass in our room for a drink. The decor was shabby and the toilet was stained. The continental breakfast we were offered was nothing more than tea and toast as they had run out of everything else half an hour before breakfast finished, when I approached a member of staff about this she just laughed!! We got our things, checked out and had breakfast elsewhere. What a total waste of money and it ruined my weekend break!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: louisemal83
Reviews.Content: My sister, partner and I stayed at this hotel in August 2009. We booked it on the spur of the moment off lastminute.com. We checked the website and as it was awarded 3 stars we were expecting it to be basic but comfortable. We arrived late at night so the building was lit up at the front and with the white pillars made it look really nice. However, that impression was very quickly erased when we entered our rooms. My sister stayed in a single room on the second floor. Her room was tiny! If you're a bit on the tubby side foget it (luckily my sis is petite)! The bed was placed against the window so she was freezing in the night. However, the bathroom wasn't too bad. My boyfriend and I stayed in the "basement." There was a window which was covered by a tatty blind and a filthy net-curtain. We peeled back the top cover on the bed and there was a fluffy leopard-skin blanket. Not the type you can really wash in the washing machine, so god knows how many different bodies it must have come into contact with (urgh). There was a white sheet as well so we just used this. The bathroom was clean and the shower was powerful, but there was mould on the ceiling. If you get the room cheap and don't compare it with other 3 star hotels you've stayed in, then you'll be ok. The hotel could be so much better if the owners spent a bit of time updating the rooms - a paint job, decent curtains, proper blankets, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lancashiremanda
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at this hotel, was clean, the room had everything we needed. Staff was polite and friendly. Was totally accessible, 5 minute walk from Bayswater tube station which took you anywhere you wanted to go in London. Bus stop was a 5 minute walk too. Bayswater is a lovely area to stay in, with plenty of shops & restaurants & a 5 minute walk to Kensington Gardens which is lovely on a nice summers night. Will definately be coming back again next time we come to London.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing!”
Reviews.Author: BetLew
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in this hotel to have a cheap break in London but unfortunately it ended up costing us twice as much because we had to book somewhere else to stay! The receptionist was unhelpful, in the box-like room the toilet and bedding were stained, the carpet looked like it had experienced very little contact with a hoover in its long lifetime.. and whilst in the room unpacking a random 'maintenence' man just wandered in! A shocking 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: kirkbyliverpool
Reviews.Content: This hotel was filthy and unsafe for any age person. We told reception my sons good headphones was gone from the room not interestered told me to go and see housecleaning because he could nt be bothered moving .Nothing like pictures never go and waste money .Rooms was full of damp and staff at hotel looked scruffy no effort at all

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, holes in mattress, peeling carpet..”
Reviews.Author: Milosuperdog
Reviews.Content: Charged for 2nd night before we had even seen the room- which was probably quite smart on their part as we would not have stayed a second night! Tiny hotel room, dirty bed covers, lumpy pillows, REALLY poor mattress- holes on one side and totally sunk on the other! Huge sash windows that do not stay open- had to wedge ours with a chair.. carpet not tacked down by the door which made it hard to open (trust me, you do not want to get trapped in these rooms!) and carpet totally worn out by the window. The room had a balcony (you had to climb out of the window to get to it) which ran all the way along the front first floor- anyone could have opened the window and got in! The rooms had no safe- nor was one offered at reception so we had to take all our possessions with us each day. Plus side: bathrooms ok with fan, wardrobes were quite nice and you could have as much as you wanted for breakfast, but the choice and quality was not great.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ouzo18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here without reading any reviews and just picked the hotel because of the location. What a mistake we made, this is the WORST hotel that i have ever stayed in my life - The room was dirty, the bed was broken, the carpet was ripped, the door didn't even lock and the reception staff were rude and spoke very little english - complete waste of money and a disgrace!

Reviews.Title: “dont ever go there”
Reviews.Author: marley09
Reviews.Content: it was the most disgusting place i have ever stayed in spoilt my whole weekend, it should be closed down the staff r rude the place is filthy how they can call this a hotel is beyound me , the bedding was filthy,carpets thread bare no plug in bathroom sink, main light did not work the list would go on to long and this room was one of the better rooms after refusing the first 2 . Me and my friend sat in the lobby listening to all the guests complaining nobody was happy you would not let your dog stay there

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as when we last stayed.”
Reviews.Author: Hungry_TravelerUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pembridge Palace some 5 years or so ago now and when we recently decided to visit London, we thought Bayswater would be a good place to base ourselves again. The Palace has deteriorated since we last stayed there. I recommended this hotel to my business colleagues in the past but would now hesitate to do so. I like small hotels but expect a modicum of quality, service, peace and cleanliness, all sadly lacking during this visit. It was not cheap either. Sorry Pembridge - must try harder.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the Good Reviews This Place was very poor”
Reviews.Author: GnarlyDog
Reviews.Content: Booked for 2 nights Arrived to find they did not have the room that we booked directly with the Pembridge 2 months before and had a written confirmation Tried to put us into a hotel down the road. ( This Hotel was a shocker so we insisted on tthem fix thier Problem mysteriously found 2 rooms available ( we had booked a triple room) I dont blame the staff but I do hold the owenersof the Hotel. to task 3 star is a joke. Their rooms are small dirty smelly noisy thin walled and creaky floor boarded fire traps. The electrical switches in the room had live conductors exposed. The Mattress did not have protectors the pillows had stains. The bathroom had fitting falling off and mould. Just dont even bother believing the pictures on the web site. The food at breakfast was poor. No secure area to leave your luggage on the book out day so it sits in the foyer all day before you return to pick it up. There was about 20 suit cases the day we left a would-be thiefs smorgasboard.
