DONT STAY HERE BE WARNED This is an Honest Review of a very poor standard hotel that should be down graded to 1 star or back packer ( I have stay at better backpacker than this DIVE)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in!! DON'T BOOK!!!”
Reviews.Author: Betty1602
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July. The pictures that are shown on the internet of how this hotel looks are very misleading. It was dirty, it smelt and the room was the size of a shoe box. It was so small we had to move the bed so we could open the wardrobe. The towels were ancient and smelt, and felt like sandpaper. The staff were miserable and unfriendly. The dining room was again dirty, for breakfast all they had on offer was a basket with slices of bread in it and some basic brand cornflakes. We took one look at it, and walked out to get food elsewhere. I have stayed at hostels in London in the past for Â£15.00 a night, which have been a lot nicer than this hotel, which we paid Â£90.00 per night. The location is quite a walk to the underground, and there isn't many nice pubs and places to eat surrounding the Pembridge Palace. I would love to know how this hotel is rated as 3 star, what a joke. It should be shut down. If you have already booked prior to reading the reviews, my only advice, lose your money and cancel!!

Reviews.Title: “3 star must be a joke”
Reviews.Author: kloi1
Reviews.Content: This is a one star hotel worst hotel that i have been in Small and dirty rooms. Even the shades had blood stains on them we asked the service to change them and some light bulps that did not work but nothing happened. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: ChrisChaos
Reviews.Content: I found the man on reception to be friendly and polite, as was I, we had a brief chat and he upgraded me from a single to a double room for no extra charge. It certainly pays to be pleasant. The room was really quite small, but it was clean and tidy, as was the en-suite bathroom. Breakfast was fine, nothing special, but the coffee was good. All in all an excellent budget hotel in the very heart of London, I was very happy with it for the low price I paid and would use it again for an overnight stop in the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FrancesBacani
Reviews.Content: I had a great time during my stay. The staffs were generally helpful and polite. Although the room is small, it was well maintained and cleaned eveyday. I love the garden. I find it relaxing. I would definitely recommend you staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharkette44
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed in the hotel as I had to cancel my booking. I cancelled within time and was told there was a Â£5 cancellation fee which I was happy to pay. I cancelled my booking on 19th Jan 2009 - I am still waiting on my refund (and today is 11th April)!!! I booked through laterooms.com and they have been brilliant in helping me chase this, the only problem is we keep believing the hotel accounts department when they say they have refunded it. It finally got to the point where on the 9th April they yet again said they had credited my card and when we asked for proof we got a badly faxed receipt on the 10th April with a credited date of the 10th which means they had yet again lied about refunding my card on the 9th April. Laterooms even had to temporarily suspend them from trading on the laterooms web site in order to actually get them to say they hadn't refunded it yet and that they would. They don't seem to answer their phones when we are trying to contact them - what type of hotel refuses to answer phones?? and when we do get through to someone they all seem to have no idea as the one person that would know anything about it always seems to have gone home - I certainly want his working hours cause he seems to get paid for never being at work! I will be checking my accounts on Tuesday once the Easter period is over and if the refund has not occured I am taking legal action as 3 months for a refund is disgraceful. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Cheeap - Great Location - Could do with some TLC”
Reviews.Author: searsrp66
Reviews.Content: You pay for what you get, yes it could do with some redecoration, yes you can hear other guests moving around, but can't you at a lot of hotels, yes rooms are basic, tea/coffee makers in rooms would be a nice touch - breakfast is typical of a lot of hotels these days cereals, toast, tea or coffee. But the beds are comfortable, showers work, bathrooms and bedrooms are clean, location is great, and yes I would stay again. If you want total luxury you will need to pay a lot more than this accommodation in London Ratings given are based on price paid, if you want five star pay five star prices,

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: cali4niatravellers
Reviews.Content: Be warned if you book this hotel and then for unforseen circumstances need to cancel within the allotted time you will be told you will pay the Â£5 cancellation fee which is fine however they then take the whole booking fee I have spent the last 10 days trying to get a refund the accounts staff are extremely unhelpful the manager /owner is supposed to be there between 10 and 4 each day but everytime you ring he is not there he does not return calls and noone can help apparently noone else in charge therefore what happens in an emergency you are left stranded I would never book with them again however pay a little more and go elsewhere and just look at the other reviews say no more....

Reviews.Title: “Horrible in every way possible. Only good for location.”
Reviews.Author: futurafoot
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via hotels dot com where it was listed as a 3 star. It was probably ok as a hostel and certainly wasn't even a 1 star tourist class hotel in my view. I actually booked through the hotels own website where the photos looked decent and the description inviting. They also had an unfeasibly good deal on the week I wanted to stay...I should've twigged that this was too good to be true! I booked for 4nts for about Â£30 per night in a single ensuite. Which for a well-located hotel is excellent. However, I didn't get value for money or the service I was expecting from a hotel listed as 3star. A palace it aint and calling it a hotel is stretching it, more like a backpackers hostel. First of all you have to find it. The pictures make it seem that the entrance is facing the lovely square but it isn't. It's on a wide street where it's Princes Sq on one side of the street and Leinster Sq on the other. Confusing and annoying when you've got to trek your luggage in sub-zero wintryness. First impressions weren't great. The reception staff were brusque and made you feel like you were disturbing their telly watching. I was given a card key and hoped that this would lead me to a clean, comfortable, quiet room. Luckily they had a small lift and I was on the 2nd floor. I got out and the carpet was worn out in places and alarm bells in my head sounded. Passing through the narrow - one person at a time - corridor I saw that some room doors had obviously been broken into before. My room had two single beds with large sash window looking out onto the square which was nice. Except the windows were old and dirty. The room was a riot of multicoloured patterns from the carpet, curtains and bedspread. It hurt my eyes to look at it all, so I ripped off the frilly flowery nylon bedcover. To my horror, there was fluff and hairs all over th underside of it. I flung it on top of the wardrobe and there it stayed. The pillows were flat and rubbish and the bedding was cheap and nasty. No duvets just fleecy blankets and sheets. I wasn't looking forward to sleeping on it. There wasn't much heating on and it felt very cold. The bathroom was ok, some mould on the tiles. But you could tell that they try to keep it clean but the fixtures are old and worn out giving further bad impressions. The shower worked ok but there was no bath plug (NB to work the shower just turn the large middle knob on its own). The towels are old and frayed and not as fresh as expected. I thought that the single toiletry - sliver of soap - they provided was too funny. I later went out and bought a bar of baby soap from Boots for 57p so that I could compare them. I expected to have tea/coffee making facilities in my room but nothing was evident. When I asked about this they said that it was available only from the reception lobby. The TV worked ok and there was a pathetic little hairdryer in the dressing table drawer. There was hanging space but not enough hangers or any shelves. My door had a huge gap at the bottom where the whole floor was on a slant. I had to open my bathroom door across it to obscure it. Don't expect to get much good sleep or any possibility of a restful lie in. Get earplugs. The floors and doors creak and you can hear the person next door or above you snoring, walking, flushing toilet. You don't have the option of not being disturbed in the morning because the eastern european maids must be paid by the number of rooms they clean and they're very persistent. They'll knock loudly from about 8am and keep on. They probably think that everyone likes to get up early and have breakfast on holiday! I don't eat breakfast so I can't comment on what that was like - I can only guess. I suppose the maids being persistent is a good thing as the rooms are cleaned as well as possible and at least I didn't get bitten by any bugs (first thing I did was look for signs of buglife!) Overall, the hostel is shabby and staff are abrupt and verging on the rude. The beds, bedding and towels all need complete change. If it's not hotel whites it must be hiding something? I left a day early and went home. I couldn't stand it anymore. I'd spent the whole day out touring lovely London and meeting friends in the evening but hated knowing that I wasn't going to get a comfortable and restful sleep in that place. The ONLY good thing about the hostel is the location. Being so close to Bayswater and Queensway tube, restaurants, shopping and several good bus routes. Walking distance of Kens' High St and Portobello. If this is your only criteria then good luck but I would strongly advise you to budget more. The extra Â£20 a night or whatever on top would make sure that you do stay somewhere nicer, cleaner and restful for your trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Dave1987
Reviews.Content: You know...this place fits its purpose, for sure it aint the ritz, but its fairly near bayswater tube station. Me and a mate stayed here on 22nd December after a pretty heavy night out in Leicester sqaure. Small rooms, but clean enough. The place looks like one or two converted houses and is loacted in a small sqaure with lots of similar hotels/hotels nearby. At the end of the day, it fit its purpose as a place to crash at the end of a night out, and for Â£30 off lastminute.com (Â£15 each) you can't really go too far wrong.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 1 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ludilo
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I believed that it was a 3 star hotel, as it said on the internet, I liked the pictures on the web site and it said that the hotel was recently refurbished. However, the hotel was more like a youth hostel, I was extremely disappointed and also mad because I have been lied to. My room was the smallest one I ever saw, one person must lye on the bed in order for the other person to walk around the bed. The bathroom is so small that there is no way 2 people can stand inside at the same time. There were a few ants (reception and bathroom). The windows were very dirty. Carpeting old, hole in the ground. The sheets were clean and the bathroom was clean, but no glass for tooth brush, no shower gel or shampoo. Breakfast was very simple but ok - boiled eggs, toast, butter, jam, ... Walls so thin, every time somebody walks by your room they wake you up. I did not believe the horrible reviews I read but I saw for myself they were true. I would rather add 20 pounds per night or so and have a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL experience. Do NOT go.”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeCam
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is terrible. The low price was an attraction for us but in retrospective it is better to spend few pounds more and go elsewhere. On arrival they wanted to send us to another hotel, we insited and they gave us an horrible, squallid and dirty room. The reception of the hotel looks great and it is the only part of the hotel that is decent. All the rest is run down and dirty. The breakfast was abismal! i cannot believe the fact that we had breakfast made us choose this hotel over others as there was only sliced bread, loose tea bags and a jug of hot water! Also, breakfast finished at 10 and at 10 on the clock very rude ladies came out of the kitchen, shouting 'breakfast was over' and we all had to leave, shut all the lights (despite the breakfast room being full of other people) and started hoovering under our table! This was at 10.03!!! Never been treated so unprofessionally! they have no sense of business and do not have a clue of how to keep constumers happy! DO NOT GO to this hotel, an HOSTEL would a better, confier, more polite and definitely CLEANER place!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fair price, no real complaints”
Reviews.Author: MarkusMalahide
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights on a work trip to London in early August 2008. Room was small, but very clean. Bathroom was separate from the room in the corridor, but a private one for this room. Service was ok and internet connection available in the lobby. Breakfast sufficient. I only wish they had had the possibility to leave the luggage in a separate room, not in front of the reception desk. Location is ok on a quiet street just a stroll away from Bayswater underground station. I think in London my stay in this hotel for two nights (total 129 euros) was a fair deal.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sthmelb
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 7 nights - what a major mistake! Arrived in from Australia in the early hours of the mornings to be greeted by a rude member of staff who showed no consideration of getting into a room earlier. I had to leave my bags in the main lobby with 200 other bags where anyone could take what they want. Finally got into my room - what a disgrace! Iron marks embedded into the carpet with as many grease stains than what you would find on a footpath outside. I instantly complained and was told to ring last minute who they ended up ringing the hotel - lastminute were no help at all and was stuck there for 7 days. The bed was rock hard and lumpy - I had to roll a towel up to place under my hip for some comfort. The bathroom had mould in it and the shower curtain was about 10 years old, Not once in 7 mornings did I have even a luke warm shower. Breakfast was OK but they would continually run out of stuff - once it got to close of time for breakfast the staff would turn the lights off with the place still full of guests - quiet funny to see some Italian guy go off his nut and demanded they keep serving. Overall don't even consider this place and suggest never book a hotel for then 1 or 2 nights or you will get stuck there.

Reviews.Title: “Health Risk Warning Warning”
Reviews.Author: dharris65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into this hotel the matres and pillows are stained with years of SEAMAN, BLOOD AND BODY FLUID!!! Don't every stay here if you know whats good for your health.

Reviews.Title: “Never a rating of 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: gerpos
Reviews.Content: I never expected a Ritz or Marriot hotel. The staff in the hotel were very friendly, with a perfect wake-up service, but this was the only thing that was allright. The room was very small, the beds were squeaky, but clean. The bathroom was terrible. Very much demage and after the shower we needed people from the staff to close the showertap. The floor and walls were very noisy (wooden squeaky floors). The most bad experience was the breakfast. Only one dish at the time with 8 slices of toast on ca. 60 people. There was only cheese and marmelade and cornflakes. No fruit and no meats. The breakfaststaff was very rude and not interested in the guests. We took afterwards a breakfast in the town. There is only a coffee and thea-bar in the hotel. My personel rating for this hotel is between 1 and 2 stars and absolutely no 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “3 star rating.... that's a joke”
Reviews.Author: poppy131
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via lastminute.com. Firstly the photos which you find on the hotel web site have obviously been taken on a good day. We did not expect the Ritz but as another review reads it is more like a hostel than a hotel. We felt very uncomfortable in the room, it was dull, dusty and very dingy. The carpet was filthy, the beds were disgusting (cleanish sheets) but the thought of the blanket or bedcover any where near my skin made the shiver. I felt itchy the whole time in the room. The paintwork has not had a coat of paint for years, the curtains were dusty and dirty. 3 star rating is a joke. I would not rate this even 2 star. As if the rooms were not bad enough, the continental breakfast was unfit for human consumption. We went down for breakfast, and stayed there long enough to be totally horrified by what we saw. The toast had mould spots, the cheese looked sweaty, the milk was sour. We could not escape quick enough. All in all definately not recommended. Awful place, will never ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “good value budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: karlofandango
Reviews.Content: For a cheap and cheerfull budget hotel in the heart of London i would recommend this one-ok i admit its not the best room ive ever stayed in but for Â£22.50 b+b per person per night in the center of London what do you expext.The rooms were quite small but they were clean and tidy and the bed gave me a good nights sleep. The hotel is about 3 or 4 mins walk from Bayswater tube staion so is in ideal location to visit Lodons top attractions via the underground I personaly wouldnt worry about all the negative comments on here about the hotel as some people just expect 5* treatment for 2* prices-i will be be booking this hotel again in the future as its a good value buget hotel. karl/rach july 31 08

Reviews.Title: “Hotel...More like Hostel!!”
Reviews.Author: trudes666
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BOOK YOUR STAY HERE!! My partner and I stayed here last night (29th July 08) we weren't expecting The Ritz but we were not expecting this! We booked through lastminute.com for a double room in central London - at first we thought Great price and they throw in a Contintental Breakfast. We arrived and was shocked ,we were told to go a dingy basement room (B01) the room had a double bed but there was certainly not enough room for 2 people to be walking at the same time! The bathroom was a complete joke - some old shower probably still in there from when the house was built which, no matter how hard you try floods the bathroom floor - and overflows the stand that you are in - causing a little pool in your bathroom. The sink was off the wall and the toilet was filthy! The bed was rock hard - probably would have been comfier laying on the wet bathroom floor, and the bed was disgustingly full of stains over the mattress and the pillows. There were also bug remains on the walls and ceilings! As we were staying for one night only we thought we would tough this night out and get out of that hell hole as quickly as possible in the morning. The nights sleep was almost as terrible as the room. The door down the hall squeaks so loudly when people use it and slams even louder.In general it was pretty noisy throughout the whole night with people slamming doors, banging on the walls, leaky taps, and being in the basement you got all the noise from the staff at some unearthly hour! We were half looking forward to going for a nice contintenal breakfast.....to be faced with sweaty off cheese, moudly bread and stale toast. The Milk was off and you also had the option of having a very cold boiled egg! I would highly recommend that no-body goes through this experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horror experience”
Reviews.Author: ecitizen
Reviews.Content: Booked via some last minute website. Upon arrival and obtaining the key to some dangy basement room which the hotel called a quad room, we were taken aback. Definitely a 1 star and not 3 star as depicted in the website. There's just enough room to maneuver around the room. Our four suitcases had to be left vertical. The mattress looks like they been used for a very long time. The pillows looks yellowish. The view of the outside world was limited to looking into neighbouring pipes and drains with just a hint of sunlight and the greenery which fellow travellers have mentioned further below. Arrived on a thursday with the plans to depart the following thursday. Viola, the receptionist expressed SURPRISE that we were going to stay that long. Truth be told, we didn't. We asked for better rooms but were told nothing available until Sunday. Jose! We handed the keys back straight away once the reception guy confirmed that we will incur a 2 day stay penalty. This I accepted. I called the booking agency and they said they'd liaised with the hotel for my refund. Over the next few days, the hotel played hardball. Example..receptionist will say they have no idea where their manager is. My booking agency called them on numerous occassion to be told the same thing. I showed up at the hotel for two consecutive days to be told the same thing. Am still waiting for my refund. My advice to all of you fellow travellers is to read the above again if you're even half thinking about staying at Pembridge Palace Hotel. Bayswater is a wonderful place to stay. Few minutes from Whiteleys shopping arcade. Marks and spencers and Tesco supermarket nearby. Central Line at Queensway which is a minute walk from Bayswater station served by both the Circle and District Line. Great Chinese restaurant especially Hung Tao for their roasted duck rice. Fantastic Italian meals at Bella Italia. I shifted to Grand Plaza at 42 Princes Square, Bayswater, W2 4AD, London. Cost me 40% more but got 3 times the space and ten times the cleanliness. This location is even closer to the center of life at Bayswater. Best for stays 7 days and above. Meanwhile I am keeping my fingers crossed towards my claim for 5 nights of refund.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcome surprises!”
Reviews.Author: Oktawia
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this place to anyone! On the first day while I was using the bathroom, a mouse ran in under the door, ran across my feet and ran out! Naturally we were forced to change rooms. I was assured via email there would be room for three in our room because a friend was joining us on the third day. What was not specified in the email was the fact that there was only room for a cot big enough to accomodate a small child. While booking I made it clear that there would be 3 adults, yet I was given a room that was too small for all of us. The front desk made me print out my reservation emails, and called in another person before I was given a room for 3 adults, which was what I wanted from the start. Furthermore, the hotel staff never apologized or even admitted to a misunderstanding! It was a pretty miserable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: charlottemoon
Reviews.Content: very weird hotel! dont go there unless you have a very good price. more than 50 pounds a night would be a steal. Room very small, not so clean, a lot of noise. Staff friendly but not very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: tashandbradworldwide
Reviews.Content: Overall this place was pretty great budget acommodation. Of course, it's not a palace by anyone's standards but it's in a great location in a quiet part of town and if you're just looking for somewhere to rest your head without emptying your wallet this is a good hotel. The room was pretty small, and bizarrely, had a pink lightbulb (?!) but was exactly what we needed. Breakfast was standard for these sort of places, toast, cereal, juice etc, but if you don't expect much, it's good. Enough options to get you started in the morning. Reception staff are very unhelpful and the showers are cold but at this price you're not expecting the Hilton. Probably best suited to younger backpackers and travellers, as older people seem to have a lower tolerance for this kind of accomm. You get what you pay for :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: pstadnick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pembridge in 2 different occasions, staying at both its single and double rooms. The single room was very small, there were no ensuite facilities, and it was crammed behind some stairs. The double room was better (more spacious), on the ground floor, with nice windows. The breakfast was reasonable. The location is good, there are 2 tube stations nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: joelpel
Reviews.Content: There was a power outage in the hotel that lasted more than 2 days, and the staffs kept on telling us that the problem will be fixed soon but they do not know when. Rooms and hallways were dark, no elevator and worse of all, no water. Then finally they offered us to transfer to another hotel, on the second day. They do not have intentions of transfering us if I did not complain. I reserved and paid for 2 rooms, but then, they only gave us only one room in the hotel where we got transferred. Before we left Pembridge, the staff told us that we already got 2 rooms, but when we got to the hotel where we transferred, they said Pembridge only gave us 1 room. What a money grab. Very unfair !!! It was my girlfriend and my brother's first time in the UK and they had a bad hotel experience. Do not ever patronize this hotel !!! Go to the Duke of Leincester, a few blocks away with almost the same price as Pembridge. Staying at Pembridge is like staying in a filthy hostel. Do not book at this hotel or you will get disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Average, good if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: PlasticCastle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the Bayswater area about 5 minutes from Bayswater underground and 10 minutes from Hyde Park. Plenty of restaurants, pubs, cafes and shops nearby. I couldn't say anything negative about this hotel. The room and bathroom were clean and the beds were okay. The room itself was not that big and breakfast was rather basic. If you're looking for a clean bed, a place to rest after exploring the city and you're on a budget this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: Szabolcs1
Reviews.Content: I was really positively surprised to find such a good hotel in that hotel price category. Clean, freshly refurbished bathrooms, clean and comfy beds, good looking reception area, friendly staff and no hassle stay alltogether. Within walking distance to 3 tube stops and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Bad facility and worse service”
Reviews.Author: CasualTravelerEx
Reviews.Content: My brother and I arrived at the hotel late at night to be greeted by a some what creepy neighborhood. Received a basement room that caught cigarette smoke from an adjacent room which had a porch right outside our window. Electricity sockets had to be traced by following the (tiny) TV cable. Acoustics were just unbearable as noises from all direction bothered our sleep. Management did little to intervene when young school guests smoked and shouted at night. Breakfast was crummy, but that could be expected from the budget (45 pounds a night for a room with two beds). We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights (as we were expecting a couple of pre-ordered packages to arrive at the hotel), planning to spend another night in Liverpool and then returning to a 3rd night in the hotel. The concierge would not agree to hold our bags for a night while we traveled inland - which was a big surprise - as all the bags of the checked-out guests were just placed unattended in the hotel lobby...

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're desperate!!!! NOT in Kensington!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowLynz
Reviews.Content: Where to start?!?! Booked a double room through lastminute, and to be honest i wasnt expecting much for Â£40. We arrived at around half ten at night, and had to walk a wee bit from paddington station (you can get a tube, but its not that far a distance). There were loads of people hanging about in the street, and there were some really dodgy hotels in the street. My boyfriend and i felt very self conscious, as it was obvious that we were tourists. I would also like to point out, this hotel is NOT in Kensington!!!! it is across the park in Bayswater, which is actually a red light district. The hotel was very quiet, and when we checked in, i had to give my card over to be pre-authorised for Â£50 worth of charges, 'in case there were any damages'. I have never had to do this in any other hotel i have stayed in. We were given a basement room, which was tiny. It was also extremely cold, and there were no spare covers or anything, which resulted in me picking up the cold. It had two single beds, a wardrobe, a small tv and that was it. there was hardly any room to move, but it seemed clean. There were no curtains on the windows, so anyone passing on the relevant street could have seen right in, and we also were woken up very early by the sun shining in!! We were glad to leave, especially as i had read reviews mentioning the bedbugs etc, so we were glad to get up and leave to get to our very nice hotel in Kensington!! I will say, the bathroom was fairly nice, to the point that it didnt look like it belonged to the room (or the hotel!!). We didnt bother to stay for breakfast, as frankly speaking, i wouldnt have eated out of there, so i cant comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms to small, really bad breakfast, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: JeanneCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: The hotel has not been renovated for quite some time. The wallpaper was falling off, the panels very dirty, the elevators are dangerous to use we felt, no hot water in the morning (and that was every morning) in the breakfast room there isn't enough place for guests, they bring 8 pieces of toasted bread once every 10 min. (we were 30 people waiting for bread) and it is the same every morning even if you start at 7 or at 9.30. You also had to wait for coffee cups if you were so lucky there was coffee. This is not a place to stay if you like just a little comfort. But i guess it is ok for backpackers. I do sound very negative but I must tell you I travel a lot all over the world and this place is the worse I have stayed in considering the rate for the room. I stayed there for 5 nights with my daugher. One positiv thing is that it is very close to Bayswater and Quenssway underground and nearly any noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: hungryjenny
Reviews.Content: Having booked a double room online for Â£40, I was a bit worried about the whole 'you get what you pay for' situation. But I wanted to save money for going out in London itself and after staying here, the risk was worth it! Sure, it's not a five star hotel, but it was perfectly clean and pleasant. It was in the opposite direction to where we had planned to hang out in London but it's fine if you don't mind hopping around on the tube. Had difficulty finding the hotel from the tube station but I think that was more due to my lack of direction rather than the hotel being hidden. Bed was a bit too soft but bedding was clean and there were fresh towels. Bathroom was spotless and shower was nice and powerful. Breakfast wasn't too bad either, the cereal is not that fresh though but there was always fresh toast being brought out. Boiled eggs and cheese also available with hot and cold drinks. The staff could have been a bit friendlier and I was a bit nervous when I had to enter my pin number to unlock the authorisation charge of Â£100 - I still don't really understand what that was about - it's some sort of security check on your card I think to make sure we had paid? Well, I did double check when I got back home and I hadn't been charged an extra 100 quid! I would definitely stay there again because of the price but probably not if I wanted to stay more than a couple of nights. If you only need a place to sleep and wash, this is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: minimodmk1
Reviews.Content: booked the pembridge hotel the day before we travelled through lastminute.com which cost Â£48.00 for a double room with breakfast. on arrival the room we were allocated was in the basement which is next door to the breakfast room. the room was very tiny and the shower cubicle was full of green mould and some of the lights didnt work. the bedding was of very poor quailty and we both felt it was cold at night. the radiator did not work or they have the heating on a timer which come on in the morning. breakfast was another issue. because the room was next door to the resturant the noise from other guests did cause for an early start!!. when we did go for breakfast we could not find a table so we ended up eating in the room we had been allocated. Quality of breakfast was just ok, but then again for the price we paid i cannot really grumble. location wise is ok short walk to the underground stop, some nice pubs and resturants near by. would i stop at the pembridge hotel again?.. well it served its purpose but when i visit again in feb the pembridge would be a last resort

Reviews.Title: “enjoy yourself!”
Reviews.Author: giorgiona
Reviews.Content: 29-12-2007 we have just returned from a shopping day in london...we are very glad to stay in this quiet area,after have stayed in all that chaos of the city centre!coming back we have enjoyed the characteristic aspects of bayswater zone and also bought some english souvenir for our friends! if you like the quiet,but also the noisy life of this beautiful town you should come in this hotel because it is in a central but not so noisy area...and the hotel is comfortable and nice too! enjoy you visit in london as we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the PPH!”
Reviews.Author: rachelkaty
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service, Room quality with the price... GREAT location! The lift comes in handy!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Regina1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pembridge Palace hotel for 4 nights, 4th-8th of June 2007. Our stay was surprisingly pleasant as we had been getting increasingly worried after reading the bad reviews. We booked through (--) and the price for a double room was GBP 55. The staff, all of which spoke excellent English, was helpful, we needed a ligthbulb and it was changed right away and when we asked if we could borrow a wine opener they saw to it right away and brought it to our room. The room was on the 3rd floor next to the elevator and was small but clean. The lobby was really nice with beautiful chandeliers. We had some problems with the TV's antenna and could only watch one channel. The bathroom was in mint condition, and the water pressure in the shower was REALLY good, with as much hot water as we wanted. We had expected some bed-bugs and that scared us as we don't have any in our country, Iceland, but didn't encounter any. Maybe we just got lucky, who knows, but everything was to our satisfaction and we would definately stay in this hotel again. If you come there by taxi tell the taxi driver that the entrance to the hotel is on Leinster Square, which is a one-way street, as it is not that easy to find, and our taxi driver cruised a bit trying to find the hotel. If you come by train then Bayswater station is a 5 minutesÂ´ walk from the hotel, just take a left turn when you come to Whiteleys Shopping Center, walk to the end of that part of Prince's Square, turn right and then immediately left on Leinster Square and in the middle of that street is the hotel. Once found it is easily found again :) Bayswater Road is just a 5 minutes' walk from the hotel where you can catch buses to Oxford Street and the ride takes about 5 minutes. One of the buses takes you directly to Piccadilly Circus so it is easy to get back to the hotel if you want to spend your evenings down-town. The ride back at nights takes about 18-20 minutes. The staff then ordered a cab for us for Stansted airport for GBP 50, which is a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cheap but Nice”
Reviews.Author: sissi74
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It 's basic but nice. I booked a triple room and it was fairly large and the bathroom not so small and new. The breakfast consist in bread, butter, marmelade , milk , coffee , tea anc chocolate...the underground stop is about 5 minute on foot...The portobello market is close...

Reviews.Title: “Pembridge hotel”
Reviews.Author: aqswdefr
Reviews.Content: Well stay and confortable. Very near the centre and tube so it's ok for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: HorsesFirst
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what is to be expected in this price range and area. I bet the two glowing reviews below were written by staff! The reception area is tidy, there are lifts. My room was a little small for the furniture - not much floor space but enough to walk around OK. The bathroom was small, recently refurbished (the Ikea label was still on the glass), just a little mould on the bath sealant but otherwise clean. The bed was comfortable but the reading light was inadequate. I had a good night's sleep and a basic breakfast - the teabags were "a little bit missing".

Reviews.Title: “decieving pls read”
Reviews.Author: ally1999
Reviews.Content: Had not read any reviews before going, wish i had though! 1)The staff were rude to begin with. 2)the internet prices kept changing, the website says one thing, the hotel says another. 3) the rooms and bathrooms are tiny. 4) the website also said there were tea and coffee making facilities in the room.... there were not, in fact it was an extra 50p per cup. 5) no such thing as express check in, while we were being treated inadequetly and like criminals the staff were rude to other guests and ignoring a complaint. 6) the towels left on our bed were DAMP!! 7) i politely asked upon booking on the form for an extra pillow. there was no extra pillow. there were no extra covers etc in the wardrobe either. TERRIBLE DO NOT GO!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying Stay With Friendly Staff! - Will come again!”
Reviews.Author: Mehdi-Ali
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Pembridge Palace Hotel for 6 days. We found the lobby stunning, spacious, modern, with a large sitting area and an average-sized outdoor sitting area. The hotel had a very convenient coffe-shop, for a few hot beverages. With friendly staff and access to internet. The dining room consisted of many seats and had no problems. Our room smelt fresh, it was a good size, coloured TV with satellite, stylish and modern cupboards/drawers. Each of us had been assisted with soap and towels. The bathroom was a satisfying size, but very modern and clean with a shower/bath. The hotel is placed in central london with many close attractions, Queensway (Shopping & Dining), Hyde Park (Beautiful park - I would recommend to visit), and many other sites to view. Overall my wife and I had a pleasing stay at Pembridge Palace Hotel and I would recommend this to all. Definetely A Pleasing Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed and bugs ... bed bugs .!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Teposu
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 days in this hotel (13 oct - 21 oct 2007) room 301. The room was ridiculously small, breakfast very poor and the restaurant dirty. But the worst was that I had bedbugs in my room, and I discovered very late (initially I thought I was allergic to smth.). At leaving I had more than 100 bites over my body and was very itchy. Generally it was a dirty hotel, one of my worst experiences in my life! Stay away!!! Today is 23 rd of October, I suffer of itchiness, I cannot sleap and I am scared to death that I could have brought some bugs at home! Shame to the Hotel! Shame to London Health Authorities (other customers made complaints regularly to them but the hotel still exists and moreover is 3 stars cathegorised)!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience I've had in London”
Reviews.Author: Horrified2007
Reviews.Content: I stay in London hotels regularly using a booking agent and couldn't get in where I normally stay when in the Bayswater area, so they offered me the Pembridge Palace. Looks great in the pictures - Nothing like the rooms I saw or stayed in. We arrived very late and the first problem was it was a twin not double as per the booking. A minor inconvenience. but then it got worse. The lights didn't work so we given the only other available room, which was next to the boiler room and the noise kept me awake most of the night. The decor was poor and there was no dressing table or tea making facilities in either of the 2 rooms. Not even glasses for a drink. The TV remote also had it's batteries taped in! The sink didn't have a plug and was blocked it also stank. The shower curtain rail was gaffa taped up and the shower tray was dirty, so we didn't use it. Then breakfast - Ha! A Bowl of hard boiled eggs, some cheese slices, jam & sliced bread. Not even toast. The crockery looked like a mixed selection from a boot sale, mostly chipped & some plastic cutlery. There was no hotel information in the room or even fire instructions. If we had arrived at a normal time we would not stayed on first impression and gone elsewhere (regarless of the fact we had already paid), but it was almost midnight. I would like to know who gave this hotel a 3* rating and anyone who says it was OK, obviously hasn't stayed in a normal hotel. This is my worst ever hotel experience ever!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: asam73
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel twice, it's really a good hotel, nice & big lobby, with tea & coffee facilities & snacks bar always available. Rooms are clean with good size and nice bathrooms (They look newly refurbished), very good & friendly staff. The hotel got a nice terrace overlooking a garden. The location of the hotel is amazing in central london, only 5 minutes walk to the hyde park & very close to the restaurants & tube stations.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: dalarna63
Reviews.Content: My daughter of 11 years, my sister and myself were staying for 5 nights at this Hotel and we were very pleased. The room ( a triple, with 1 double large bed and a single one ) were okay. The bathroom was small, but nice, my very own bathroom is also not that big, so I'm justed to the size! It was clean, every day clean towels. Breakfast was very surprising! Eggs, cereals, muesli, all kinds of brown an white breads, toast, french bread, tea, coffee, juices, milk and very nice cheese!! And of course jam and nice butter. We were very pleased and enjoyed our getting up every morning to have such a good beginning of the day! Yammie....... Okay, not all of the staff members we very happy, you could see it on their faces, and all of them came from Poland we thought, and there English was not so good, but with a friendly face you will meet another friendly face. At least we tried ;-) Our room was just above the entrance and we had a very big window that let a lot of light come in. And we had sunshine and warm weather every single day!! Next year we want to come back, and this time with my husband and our son and daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Photomaniac
Reviews.Content: There is no way this is a 3-star hotel. No way whatsoever. I tried to call them several times before arrival to inform them of my late arrival to the hotel. After numerous attempts in the evening someone finally answered. When I checked in at 4am, the receptionist was clearly annoyed by this. He gave me the room key, and one more key, saying "You will have your own bathroom". Really? So I had to go out of my room to get to the bathroom. Well, well. It probably wont kill me, I figured. Then, when I came to the room, no 213, it was freezing cold. They had left the window open, so the room was like a refrigerator. The radiator on the wall didn't work, but the room was equipped with a small heater that turned itself off all the time. The room itself was tiny, as well as the bed. I could not fit in there lying on my stomach, and I am only 180 cm. And the bathroom. If you like broken tiles, dirty floor and toilet, a shower cabinet that has been glued several times, this is the place for you. It also had two cranes for cold and hot water, placed so far off each other that you either had to use ice cold water, or boiling hot. There was no way of combining the two. All they provide for guests is towels and some crappy soap bars. No shampoo, drinking cup or things you normally find in a hotel. I did not sleep well that night. I froze all night, and the building is so old, you can hear anyone move. The only positive thing is that there was little traffic noise. I asked the receptionist if they had a hotel safe in the reception. The answer was "for documents only". Which user of this crappy hotel carries around documents? So the answer would be no. The hotel does not rent or lend out travel adapters for foreign electrical equipment, which I think is an obvious thing for a hotel to have. I paid 100 pounds to stay here three nights, and if I knew what I know now, I would never ever go here. I guess someone may think this is a "charming" place, but I don't. It is without a doubt the worst "hotel" I have ever been to. It is not easy to find either, both taxi drivers I went with had a hard time locating the entrance, and they both had GPS in the vehicles.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a health hazard and should be closed down immediately”
Reviews.Author: nac52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgusting, dangerous pit. I am appalled that the health and tourism authorities in London have not shut it down, despite the endless complaints from the bedbug-bitten, filth-surrounded, noise-withstanding guests. The number one problem with the Pembridge Palace is that it is completely infested with bedbugs, and believe me, if you have never been attacked by these blood-thirsty insects, you don't want to try the experience, especially while on vacation far from home. This hotel obviously has plenty of them, since there are numerous visitors to this site, including myself, who have been eaten alive there, then suffering days and days of itching and disfigurement. You can complain, but the hotel staff will do NOTHING to remedy the situation but change you to one of the rooms which apparently they know have no bedbugs, which only shifts the problem on to some new unsuspecting victim. How can a place like this be allowed to remain open, can someone tell me? If the bedbug danger isn't enough to keep you away, then how about this? I got trapped in the elevator THREE TIMES during my stay!!! Add to this the incredibly unfriendly staff, war-torn furnishings and carpet, a gross bathroom, dirty towels and jam-packed fire hazard of a breakfast room, and you have a recipe for disaster. I fully expect to see this hotel in the headlines someday due to some sort of catastrophe like a fire, mass poisoning from breakfast or something that has already happened: the dozens and dozens and dozens (maybe hundreds) of guests who have had their health put at risk by the London authorities who, for some reason, refuse to close this dump. Shame on you all, hotel owners, workers and local authorities.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug Palace”
Reviews.Author: traveling_maija
Reviews.Content: Stay at Pembridge Palace if you want to be eaten alive by bedbugs and wake up in the morning on sheets spotted with your own blood. This was my own experience and that of my parents. All together, we stayed in three rooms at the hotel. The first one we moved right out of because it didn't even have curtains. The second we moved out of because the room was infested with bedbugs. The third room was in the basement, smelled like mold, and had a television that didn't work. All the bad things that other guests have reported are true. The rooms are small and the place is rotting. Paint is peeling off the walls, everything is damp, nothing gets cleaned, and the staff are entirely unresponsive (Soviet style service, if you get my drift). After I got back home, I saw a total of five doctors to try and cure my tortured skin, which was covered in bites and itching like mad. It looked like I had smallpox and caused me many nights of sleepless agony. Nothing short of large-scale fumigation gets rid of bedbugs, so don't think for a moment that the hotel doesn't have them anymore. The critters are notoriously hard to get rid of. The pictures are of my Pembridge Palace bedbug bites. Hint for travelers: Always check around and under your hotel mattress and in cracks in the wall for bedbugs. If you wake up on sheets that have little spots of blood, then your hotel has bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel! Clean, friendly, convenient and reasonably priced!”
Reviews.Author: milly80
Reviews.Content: Fantastic - definitely a good reasonably-priced hotel to stay in if you're in London, especially for Notting Hill carnival!

Reviews.Title: “Confused staff, loud guests”
Reviews.Author: scoutdix
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through expedia, and upon arrival, we were beset with problems. They could not find our reservations, and then ignored us while we sat in the lobby. They were not helpful in any way. They did not try to think of any solutions for us. Finally, we tried the other name in the party (not the person who booked the hotel), and then they realized their mistake. We were not offered any apology and they acted as if it was our fault. Once we got to the hotel room, it was nice enough. The area was in the bayswater area of london, so there were a lot of cheap hotels there and this seemed one of the nicer ones. This is not saying it was anything close to a hilton or even a marriot, but it was nice enough. The other problem with the place was that some guests were very loud some of the nights and were partying in the hallways. The front desk either did not want to or was unable to do anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “OK Budget Hotel - BUT 3 star??!!???”
Reviews.Author: BeefyBazz
Reviews.Content: Booked through Ratestogo.com at around 49 GBP p/n. Stayed 10 nights. Firstly, the place was so confusing to find at 3am in the morning. Situated on Princes Square opposite Leincester Square. On arrival we checked in and only to find out that there are only non smoking rooms in the hotel when we had booked a smoking room(BUT we smoked outside the room window and no fire alarms went off... LOL). Asked the reception guy if there was internet/wireless internet in the rooms and he said "NO". Anyways turned on my laptop on the 2nd last day to find a FREE WIRELESS CONNECTION. Location was great. Very close to the Bayswater & Queensway Tubes. We had abit of a culture shock when we arrived but being greek we didnt really stand out so nobody really bothered us. Twin Room was tiny. We coulda just as well left our cases in the bathroom or lobby because they hardly fitted in the room. I was thinking to myself the whole time "What if we picked up...where would our ladies fit......????". Bathroom was new and bigger then the actual room(no jokes). Staff were not that friendly. Helpful at times but nobody really goes out of their way to greet you. Breakfast was average but ok for continental I guess. Smoking lobby downstairs was our favourate hang out after breakfast. We moved outta here and went to the Blakemore Hotel nearby. Only then did we realise what a hole this place really was. TINY ROOMS(cases hardly fit), NEW REFURBED BATHROOM(bigger then room), UNFRIENDLY HELPFUL STAFF, GREAT LOCATION, GREAT PRICE!!!! PS: DONT BE FOOLED BY THE HOTEL'S WEBSITE & PHOTOS LIKE WE WERE......expect the worst and it wont be so bad... lol

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: GHop
Reviews.Content: I had already booked the Pembridge when I read the reviews on this website and was horrified by the bad reports it had received. I would have cancelled if I could but with less than 2 days before our arrival we decided to at least look at the room. We arrived at 9am after 24 hours travelling expecting the worst and were very pleasantly surprised. I asked to see the room before checking in. It wasn't possible at that time because guests had not checked out but the manager suggested we help ourselves to the (all day free) tea/coffee in the lobby while we waited. About 11am (well before the advertised check in time), we looked at a room (121) on the first floor. Although very small it was certainly clean, overlooked the park and had quite nice decore. We ended up staying 6 nights and thought the Pembridge great value. The continental breakfast is self serve so quantity is unlimited. It consists of a choice of cereals, toast, cheese, jams, hard boiled eggs, tea and coffee. We found the people working behind the desk most helpful.... immediately getting towels for me when I asked, and helping me make an international call (and then not charging me for it). The Pembridge is an old building..for me that was part of its charm...but it comes with some maintance issues that you need to be able to overlook to enjoy your stay. Our ensuite was very clean but had 2 cracked tiles, the wardrobe was missing one of its door handles, the full length window onto the narrow balcony had to be held open with the chair. The location is great.. just off Bayswater Road... easy walking to Portabello Markets, Kensington Palace and Gardens and the Albert Hall. We also walked to Buckingham Palace, Harrods and the National Gallery. I felt perfectly safe walking walking in this area, even by myself at night. I would certainly go back to this hotel when in London but recommend trying to get there early in the day and asking to see the room before you book in... so you have some choice of room.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: ClaireyBee
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 nights as it was advertising a good deal on a website I was looking at - I can see why now! The hotel reception looks lovely - but it is misleading - the whole place needs updating and sprousing up. The staff were miserable and you think these are the people who are going to be making your stay enjoyable for the next few nights! As with the other review, I took one look at the room and wanted to run and hide - through the winding corridors, and the 15 minutes it took to find the room (walk don't trust the lifts!), it was defintly not worth the wait. The room (supposed to be a double but was a twin) was very dated, the walls were damp with the wall paper peeling. The door to the bathroom was at a slant and smaller than my hips so I had to go in sideways - you could shower use the toilet and wash your hands at the same time it was that small - clean, but small. The rooms were only Â£35 a night so i wasn't expecting much, but at the same time, i could of stayed in a travelodge for the same price and enjoyed it much more. In the end we ended up staying in the Thistle Piccadilly which was amazing - but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm, would "hideous" be too complimentary a word?”
Reviews.Author: northernlights11
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. It was just incredibly awful. The staff is not helpful at all, and when they do give information, either about the hotel or London, they were ALWAYS wrong. When we told them about the numerous problems in the bathroom, including a cracked cup, we were emphatically told that the water was undrinkable-- after we'd been drinking it because there was no sign to the contrary. Oh, but we certainly could buy bottled water from them! We ended up trying 3 rooms before finding one that was acceptable-- and our version of "acceptable" became very modest, indeed, by the 3rd room change. The first 2 were in the basement, and then someone at the front desk told us that they "usually" don't put anyone in those rooms. There were wires held together by electrical tape. The walls were marked up with numerous areas of plaster peeling off. The place was filthy. The beds were uncomfortable and the bottom sheet was directly on the mattress with no covering inbetween-- and my sheet had holes in it, so God knows what I was exposed to. The front dest staff gave us completely wrong information about buses and sites and so we didn't get to see the places we'd planned on. The free breakfast was pretty bad. The fire alarm kept going off in the middle of the night. The staff said "someone was checking it out" but never called the fire dept. They said it was because people smoke in their rooms even though it was not allowed and they "couldn't do anything about it". It was terribly maintained. The neighbourhood is fine in the day time, but at night, especially on the weekend, that particular block seems to be a hang out for young people who are quite drunk, urinating in the street, shouting at all passerbys. The tiles on the walls in the bathroom were broken and the there was water damage and mould on the bathroom ceiling. The rooms are very cramped, so you really have no place to open your suitcase. I could fill up pages and pages with more, but I'm sure you get the idea. The one positive thing I can manage to say about the place, is that the water pressure in the shower is great, and so we enjoyed nice showers. But unless that benefit is worth 70 pounds a night, STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Too much adventure”
Reviews.Author: mathtech1999
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room for 6 nights. I checked in and went to my room to relax for a little while. The room had a double deadbolt type lock which required a key to lock and unlock the door from inside or out. After an hour or two, I went to leave and realized that the lock did not work from the inside. Therefore, I was trapped. I tried to call the front desk, but the phone was not even wired-in to the jack. I had to yell out the window to get a person's attention, not easy to do, and have them come to the hotel to have maintenance sent up. Maintenance got me out and told me that that room was not supposed to have been assigned. I eventually went through six different singles on the second floor because of more minor issues before I found one that was acceptable, but it still had the bedding from the previous guest. I took the bedding from a previous room and exchanged them so that I had clean sheets and blankets. Also, the bathrooms for the singles are private, but they are in a secondary hallway, and the door probably will not latch making it impossible to lock. The location is good, and I was able to talk the front desk person into storing some sodas that I had bought in their refrigerator that they use to keep drinks for sale. I also could not find a working electric outlet in my room, so I had to charge my portable devices in the lobby. Therefore, I got to know the staff a bit better than I normally would. They were quite nice people, but the building itself is not maintained well.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful”
Reviews.Author: Ryan_Geneva
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for three nights but it was so awful that I couldn't stay at this place and had to look for another hotel. The room was very small, dirty, shabby and smelly. I really didn't want to sleep there neither unpack my suitcase. The staff was very unfriedly and they couldn't even correctly speak english. So if you want to have a nice trip to London avoid this place!

Reviews.Title: “Run AWAY from this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: misskimmy62
Reviews.Content: Pembridge Palace was the worst hotel I have EVER stayed in. This hotel does not have one redeeming factor. The staff was rude, surly and once a bit threatening. The breakfast was horrible, it consisted of hard boiled eggs, bread and cereal. It reminded me greatly of a nursing home where you would put someone you hated.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: DavidCincinnati
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the Pembridge Palace for a single room at 90 BGP a night. Having made several prior trips to London, Paris and Munich, I know that rooms are small so this met my expectation. Unfortunately, while the bathroom appeared to have been recently remodeled with nice tile, the sleeping area was shabby. There were portions of wall that hadn't been painted or had been covered with unpainted patching. Based on the soil and wear, it appeared it hadn't been touched in several years and there was some paint on the carpet. While the entry door locked, the auxilliary deadbolt was frozen and would not turn. The bed was against the window which had no bars so on a hot night take care not to roll or you may drop two stories to the walk below... the size of the room didn't allow me to relocate the bed (by the way, no AC for you summer guests). The towels were cleaned each day but, as others have noted, had an odd odor to them (some days I received a bath and hand towel, other days no bath towel but three hand towels); otherwise, my bathroom was cleaned daily, The worst aspect of the whole visit was the noise. There are numerous firedoors that bang loudly and the fire alarm sometimes briefly sounded throughout day and night. EVERY night there was noise on the street below including loud conversations (sometimes including the night deskman who chatted with taxi drivers), a linen truck that visited around 3 a.m., revelers, etc. While much of this is outside of the hotel control, I averaged only 4-5 hours of sleep a night that was periodically interrupted and poor sleep can diminish the quality of one's overall visit to London. At this price, I've had much better rooms and I would recommend you do your homework before booking this hotel. Otherwise, the location is convenient for the Tube, services and dining and I found the staff relatively friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I got what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at this hotel. I found the property by the web and the price was right and I knew the location. I was expecting a small pokey room, but I was given a twin room on the ground floor with a lovely big window overlooking the park. The bathroom was of an older style, and apart from the shower curtain - which they changed, spotlessly clean. The staff were mostly eastern european, and sometimes language was a problem. But no great hassle. They directed me on the tube, recommended a good laundry, and organised a taxi to Waterloo all with no bother. In a nut shell, I got a clean hotel room - in good location - at a good price. Which is exactly what I wanted. I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in May. Overall, there is nothing spectacular about this hotel but there is really nothing to complain about either. Our room was relatively spacious and most importantly clean. The staff were kind, friendly and very helpful. Another salient point is that we felt safe there and this was important for us as our room had been broken into at another hotel which we had stayed in for the previous 5 nights we were in London. We had a pleasant stay there and would definitely stay here again on our next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: OntarioSnowbirds
Reviews.Content: I went to England (for the first time) with my step daughter on a school trip for 10 days in May (college). If you have never travelled to Europe, it is definately an eye opener regarding culture and the way they see things over there. I was a little shocked at first on our room as it was really small and crowded, but I was prepared also because of the other reviews I have read. 1. Ask for extra pillows immediately. They only provide 1 on each bed and they ran out of extra pillows on the 1st day. 2. Take bug spray and spray yourself good before you go to bed. We found huge spiders in our room every day. We did not however see any bed bugs. 3. The elevator is scary. We were on the 4th floor and were contstantly being stuck in it. If your not claustrophobic, you'll survive. 4. The bathroom was actually not bad at all. We always had clean towels...but, we never had hot water in the morning. Take your showers at night if you can. also, they do not provide Kleenex, an alarm clock, or any type of radio. Bring your own because it's EXPENSIVE in the stores. I bought a $3.99 travel alarm to bring with me. 5. They provide coffee and tea on the main floor 24/7 which is nice. I brought a travel mug with me so that I could bring up to my room without any spillage as they only provide little take-out cups. (I never went to the breakfast, so I can't comment on that). 6. Google the area!!!!! All the buildings look the same and it is very confusing if you don't have a good map with you. It took us 2 days to get our bearings. Overall. The hotel was satisfactory. The owners do not speak very good english though and they are not very pleasant either. But.....I wasn't there to socialize with them anyways. They were though happy to give me an adapter for my video camera to use since "Source One" sold me the wrong one!! That was nice of them. We were on the 4th floor which is pretty tight, so try and stay lower if possible. We did not hear lots of noise although we were facing the street, and as a matter of fact I think it was actually quieter than my own home!! We did sleep good. (Oh yeah.....only 5 channels on the t.v.!) You are very close to the Subway, shops, Restaurants (both cheap and expensive) Movie Theatre, Nottinghill (which has a great Saturday Market), and KengsingtonPark being walking distance. I think that I would actually go back for the price, but not stay as long. Good luck and have fun. It's a chance in a lifetime if you can take it!

Reviews.Title: “Pembridge palace is not so bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i've been in pembridge palace hotel for a week. my room wasn't very big but was clean and bathroom too. the hotel is in a beautiful part of London (Bayswater) and it's near the tube stop... i think i'll come back there in a next visit of london

Reviews.Title: “The Pembridge Pit”
Reviews.Author: smjonz
Reviews.Content: The place is a pit! Our hotel room, which was the size of a postage stamp, had dirty curtains, a broken window that was literally scotch taped back together, a shower curtain with ripped holes so that it fell from the shower curtain clips, and one could literally feel every coil in the bed. The walls may as well have been made of cardboard for all the soundproofing they provided. I was up all night listening to the people next door. I couldn't even get angry at them because it wasn't their fault the hotel's soundproofing is ridiculous. Stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Most awful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This March, my husband and I stayed for 3 nights. 3 nights too long. The bathrooms were dirty, shower curtain moldy, no hot water, and bed extremely uncomfortable. That wasn't the worst of it though. After our first night there, I woke up to find myself covered in red bumps all over my arms, ankles, neck and face. At first I thought i got an allergic reason to something, but wasn't sure. That night, we came back to our room, to find little bugs lerking around the headboard. We went down to reception and they switched our room, as you could imagine we were pretty freaked out. After doing some research we soon realized they were BED BUGS (confirmed by my dr, after arriving home). We asked the front desk if they knew what the bugs were-said no, basically completely acting dumb. Apparently, after digging around the internet, I am not the first person this happened to at this specific hotel. The hotel did nothing, and for the rest of my trip I was an itched disfigured mess. WARNING: Do not stay here. It is an awful hotel not suited for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lanie21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prembridge Palace Hotel for 5 nights in January. Staff was very unfriendly and not very helpful. We had a room overlooking the street which was very loud with traffic (drag racing neighbors with loud radios on the street until 3am). Staff did nothing about complaints when this went on for 3 nights. Room was very small, beds uncomfortable, room was never cleaned execpt for picking up the towels, which had a strange smell. Shower curtain was moldy. The faucets in the room were a joke - had to turn the sink and shower faucets around 2 time before water came out. Elevator was slow, and scary. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good-not great”
Reviews.Author: lala_ie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fine for anyone who just wants to come and go as they please. I would advise people looking for a romantic break not to stay here though, as the rooms are paper thin and you can hear EVERYTHING. Rooms are tiny, but thats something to expect from all London hotels. There is no smoking in any of the rooms so if you are a smoker, you must use the smoking area beside the reception. After reading the reviews we decided to have breakfast elsewhere, so I cannot give an opinion on that. There is no bar in this hotel, although if you feel a thirst, there are tea/coffee making facilities in the reception and bottles of water and soft drinks are sold for 1 pound at the reception. If you are looking for a direct tube in to the centre, go to Notting Hill Gate station, which is only five minutes walk away, past the station, five minutes down the road is the Portobello Market which is well worth a look. No problems here with smelly towels or bed bugs etc, so I guess they have sorted out those problems because everything was clean. If there is one complaint I would make is the cold in the rooms, as the ceilings are so high, they take forever to warm up, we put the heating on full but when we came back from shopping on the first day the room was still freezing, so we put our bags lined up at the door to block the gap at the end of the door and when we came back that evening the room had warmed up. The sheets are very thin, more what I would expect from a spanish hotel where you only need sheets to cover you because of the heat, but this was London in the middle of January, so a proper quilt would not have gone a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Palace????”
Reviews.Author: Corina82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights. Okay, it isn't expensive but for this money you can find comparable hotels more in the city center. The room was small, and the bed also. It was noisy, you can hear the neighbours all the time. The staff wasn't friendly, they provided free safes, at the reception desk, but every time you need something out of your locker the staff wasn't polite and helpfull. The're was a breakfust buffet, it was a very bad buffet, in a shabby basement with not enough space for the guests (so go for a very early breakfast) In my opinion they should stop serving breakfast, you can better eat in one of the hundred coffeebars in the morning. And last but not least: the location: the hotel is not very near a tube station. The neighbourhood is not bad but it is boring. To go to the center you must step over on the tube, there is no direct line to the center. Especially in the evening when you might to catch the last tube, that isn't handy. And i've forgotten the star rating: this is absolutely not a three star hotel. More a 1+ or 2 star hotel. But London is an amazing city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was not clean when we arrived. When we told the front desk, we were told nothing could be done about it til the following morning. The sheets also had stains on them. However, because the stains were on the sheets, we were able to tell that over the three night stay in the hotel, the sheets were never changed. The stains staid in the same place. The elevator was also very scary. It was old and would jeark up and down and sometimes wouldn't move. I would not reccomend this hotel, even thought it is cheap and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Expect a typical London hotel!”
Reviews.Author: plunk07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very average. My husband and I stayed here for a week in August and had heard previously not to expect too much from London hotels, however we were surprised with the state the hotel was in. The lobby is quite nice with staff that do their job but don't offer any friendlyness. The lift is very old but pretty spacious compared to others i've seen, although it can be fairly tempremental and not move at all sometimes. We worked out the trick is to not push any buttons until everyone is in the lift, then it doesn't get stuck! The hallways are a good indicator of the state of the hotel; the walls are covered in scuff marks and paint is chipped off. Our suitcases only just managed to fit down the hallway, and the floors are very sqeaky. Our room was very, very small; 2 single beds (when we'd booked a double) squished together, a cupboard in the corner that could't be opened fully because the bed was in the way and a TV on a stand. Absolutely no room for our suitcases so we had to jam them behind the door! The bathroom was not too small; a shower over a tub (which is a bonus because most hotels don't even have tubs), toilet and basin. There's no plug for the hand basin so ensure you don't leave ur jewellery anywhere near the sink! The buffet breakfast is quite adequate and filled us up til dinner on most days. It consists of toast (very, very old toaster that takes around 10mins), warm eggs, jam, cheese, 4 kinds of cereal, coffee, apple and orange juice. The staff are good at replenishing the food although they don't seem to know the words 'excuse me' because they tend to push to get past you. Overall, in my opinion, the most important thing when staying in London is that the hotel is clean because it's main purpose is a base to sleep at night. This hotel is at least clean and serves that purpose, plus we got it for $80 AUD per night so no complaints with the price! After travelling the rest of Europe, we stayed at this hotel again on arriving back in London because it was clean and central to the city. Our room (314) was much nicer and bigger than on our 1st stay and it had been freshly painted. Once we got used to the quality offered in London this hotel was absolutely fine and is very close to the city and surrounds for a base.

Reviews.Title: “Great Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: jajeffers
Reviews.Content: Well, our the third party that we booked our hotel through never placed our reservation with the Pembridge Palace. That being said, we flew from Cincinnati to Paris and took the train to London (all without sleep) to find ourselves with no hotel. The man at the desk was very helpful. He allowed us to use the phone to call the vacation planner in the states so that we could find a hotel as he was booked for the night. We were there over an hour and he was very helpful and courteous. Based off of the restrooms and waiting area, the hotel seemed fairly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: amberm1
Reviews.Content: If I had read the last 2 reviews, I probably woud have gone elsewhere. But I had already booked and was on the road. This is one of the cheapest hotels in London, even if it is more expensive than the Ramada in Wisconsin. Therefore you can't expect Egyptian cotton sheets and down duvets. It's also a European hotel, meaning it's not as big as the Ramada in Wisconsin. That being said, I found this hotel to be reasonable. My room was clean, and freshly painted. And I didn't experience any bites. I had a bigger problem with other guests than the hotel itself. Someone kept pulling the fire alarm, and the line for breakfast didn't move because other people kept cutting in. I probably wouldn't stay here again because I prefer the Paddington area to Bayswater, but if the location was better for me, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Good”
Reviews.Author: CelticFire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night. Got to say the price was excellent at Â£40.00 considering the location. Also staff helped by allowing us to check in early, this meant we did not get the room we were supposed to and got one in the basement instead. That said the room was small but for 1 night who cares! There was a grubby feel to the room and in the morning the bathroom and towels smelled disgusting. The breakfast was fine. So overall, for 1 night it was fine dont think I would stay again, but if stuck would consider it, especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the cab drivers couldnt find Hotel and when we checked in the rooms were super small the bathrooms worse, the towels stunk! we ask about them they assured us they were clean..the covers on the rock hard cheap matteress were so thin you could see through them..there were no blankets to speak of..if the room hadnt been prepaid we wouldnt have stayed the one night..It was a dive..stay anywhere but not there..beware!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Health Hazard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nacozari
Reviews.Content: In order to fully explain what happened to me during my stay at this awful hotel, I will simply insert the letter I have sent to the local health authorities, as well as attaching the photos I mention in the letter: I stayed at the Pembridge Palace Hotel, located at 55 Princeâ€™s Square, London, W24PX (telephone number ------) earlier this month, from Thursday 8th September through Monday 12th September. Though the hotel was a bit small, and the triple room very cramped, it seemed clean enough superficially (except perhaps the towels, which smelled awful), but then I was to discover that there was more to the hotel under the surface. On the night of Saturday 10th September, I went to bed in a perfect state of health and nothing to report in terms of dermatological problems. When I woke up on the morning of Sunday 11th September, my body was absolutely covered with bites that appear to be consistent with bedbug or flea bites (as my dermatologist has also told me). This is most probably the source of the bites, because I was clothed with pajamas and the windows were closed entirely due to the cold (thereby excluding mosquitoes, which could not get into the covers of a bed and through the pajamas anyway). I woke up with dozens of bites, the majority of which were located on a straight line going all up my right arm, starting at the elbow and leading all the way to the middle of my back. Besides these terribly itchy bites, I also had many other isolated irritating bites on both hands, my other arm, both of my legs, both of my feet and even two on my face. Whatever was inside the Pembridge Palace Hotel room that night practically ate me alive and made the whole rest of my stay in London an itching nightmare.
