I have photographs showing the huge number of bites I had all over, and shockingly the marks from them have not completely disappeared more than two weeks later. When I attempted to complain to the management that morning, the receptionists at the front desk, though they were polite and allowed us to change rooms, never let me speak with a hotel manager. On Sunday, they claimed there were no managers available on that day of the week, and then on Monday when I repeated my request, they said there were no managers that day either. According to them, a chambermaid inspected the room and "found nothing," but anyone working in a hotel should know that bedbugs cannot be found through a quick visual inspection. I am hoping that your Health and Safety Team staff can check the place out. We were staying in room 110. My reason for writing to you is to formally complain that the hotel room which the Pembridge Palace had provided us with was completely unfit for human use. Either the bed or sheets on the single bed were obviously infested with something that needs to be fumigated (it was a triple room with a double bed and a single bed). And it would have been nice if the hotel could have offered something more than just a change of room and an apology from a lower-level employee to make up for the fact that my last two days (or in other words half of my stay) in London were a miserable nightmare of itching, scratching and bad moods, since I felt awful and looked disfigured on half my body. My whole arm and back looked as if I had some terrible disease, and I was very concerned that I might have caught something. I have written an e-mail letter to the hotel, as well, and they have not even bothered to send a response or an apology. I hope that you can investigate their premises and keep any other guests from suffering the same fate that I suffered at this disgusting, cramped hotel. If you want me to send you the photographs of the damage, I would be perfectly happy to. Sincerely, ...

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reiwievs on this hotel, we were VERY hesitant to stay there. At first it seemed that all the bad things said about the hotel were true, the staff that worked the desk at our arrival at the evening sunday september 3:rd looked almost surprised to see a busload of tourists wanting to check in. But after twenty minutes we got our keys to the room and as we entered we were more than happily surprised. Yes, the rooms ARE small. Yes, the bathrooms ARE small. BUT, of all the hotels I've stayed in all over europe the CHARM was outstanding! A little balcony just outside our window overlooking a little park where birds were singing and people with a key to enter walked their dogs. My family had two room just beside eachother, so we used the balcony as a passageway between the rooms. And we had our eveningcoffee out there as well, looking down at (and chatting with) our fellowtravellers on the veranda. A comfortable double bed with plenty of extra pillows, CLEAN fresh bedsheats with NO stains on them. Bathroom with clean towels (no stains or funny smell), a bathtub and a fan to evacuate damp. The fan was a bit noisy, but stopped after a while. Part of the charm was the ceilingheight, must have been about 4 meters and made the small rooms seem spacious when laying in bed looking up. The hotel could need some new paint here and there, maybe a bit faster check-in-routines (one of the female deskclerks were VERY serviceminded, taking time to draw us a map to LittleVenice, where we took a canaltrip with Jasons - highly recommended!). All-in-all a hotel with a good location, charming rooms, partially charming staff and I recommend it to anyone who is more interested in seeing London than watching television!! Greetings Anders with family

Reviews.Title: “Excellent follow up care”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pembridge with three traveling companions in July. The four of us shared two rooms. My traveling companions really liked the price. We had just completed a ten-day stay in Ghana; the amenities of this London Hotel were a welcome sight. The room space is very tight and we found the halls frequently noisy with conversations and slamming doors of other guests. However. . . . when I got to Gatwick Airport, I discovered that in my rush to get on the shuttle van, I left my mastercard at the hotel desk. Fortunately, I had a hotel card in my purse. A call from the airport confirmed what I feared; my charge card was left behind. The staff member was willing to arrange to have the card mailed to me in the states. I preferred that it be destroyed. My request was honored, and after I arrived home that same staff member was very responsive to my follow-up email inquiries. There is no evidence of the card being misued; I completely trusted that it was indeed destroyed and my credit card company has already replaced it. Upon a budget return to London, I would definitely consider another stay. The location was perfect for connecting with local buses and the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading and A Complete Waste Of Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had occasion to stay in this hotel for three nights his July. I booked the hotel based upon its desription in a popular website that caters for people looking for rooms at short notice. Upon arrival I was almost in disbielief at what I saw. At first I wonderered if perhaps I had arrived at the wrong place. Certainly this was not a three star hotel as i understand it to be. I found the man on the front desk (I can't name him as I can't be seen to be personally insulting anyone) rude and unpleasent. His maner and attitude to me as I checked in made me feel unwelcome and ill at ease. Once I got to my room, I found myself to be on the ground floor backing onto the patio where guests sat outside to talk and drink etc. This ment I had to keep my curtains drawn almost all the time as a matter of privacy. I also had to keep my window shut at night as the noise was preventing me from sleeping. Not ideal on a hot July night. Upon reporting this problem to the same man at the front desk i again found him rude and unwilling to be of any assistace whatsoever. Indeed he seemed more concerned with his staffing issues than my own comfort. Not what I would expect from a three star hotel. Generally, my room was shabby. It had mould on the ceiling, no tea or coffee making facilities, there were no plugs in the sink or bath and the TV reception was terrible. My stay at this "hotel" was a terrible experience and one which I would not endorse to anyone. There are much nicer places to stay in the Bayswater area for the money. If anyone can suggest a way to enforce a more suitable star rating to this hotel I would be more than happy to hear about it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay...barely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel even after the horrible reviews....and some of them are TRUE! We stayed in May 2005 for 3 nights. Our room was alright, very basic. It's what we had expected. But, the door handle to the room was almost falling off, you could actually see through to the hallway!! We didn't bother raising this issue; the staff didn't seem too friendly or professional. (I mean, when the desk clerk doesn't acknowledge your existence for 5 mins. while you're standing there, and only talks on the phone, whilst swearing, it's not too professional). And, what do you expect from a budget hotel?? The decor IS dated, but not too bad. The only thing was the stagnant "old" smell in the hotel was a bit gross. The breakfast was average, but the wait staff were really great.

Reviews.Title: “Good traveler / budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: 05graduate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for five nights in June. This was our first trip to London. We had heard that the London hotels are small, and this is true of this hotel. We had also read some very bad reviews of this hotel, and were quite skeptical of our stay. When we travel, we usually stay in moderate hotels. Therefore, we were quite pleased with this hotel. The basic facts are that this hotel is a moderate hotel. The rooms are small but were cleaned everyday. The building is old and shows some signs of this age. However, they have updated the window dressings and spreads. The bathroom was very small but very adequate. We did not travel to London to stay in the room. The free breakfast was good. I can't believe some people complain about the breakfast. Every morning there were boiled eggs, sliced cheese, toast, cold cereals, coffee and tea. The staff replenish constantly and the dining room was very bright and clean. I have no complaints with this hotel. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to London and were expecting to have a nice trip. I chose that hotel because I read "The hotel overlooks the beautiful Prince's Square private garden.". When we reached the hotel we got a room B01 - I couldn't believe that I should go to the basement. We had to sleep in the basement and that room was awful, opposite to the lift, between a room for the staff and the breakfast room and close to a public washroom. There was a window but we could be happy to see some light. Luckily we got another room the next day. But I would recommend to avoid booking that hotel if you don't want to ruin your trip!

Reviews.Title: “There must be better places !”
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda61
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, glad it wasn't the two we originally planned. Room crowded with so many beds ( that weren't needed/requested) TV very small. Don't see why in the 21st century there is an expectation that guests will travel several corridors/floors just to get a cup of coffee - I have not experienced that in a hotel for over 20 years. Room smelled a little stale Breakfast was fresh and plentiful - as long as you like bread...staff were very helpful and polite

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am glad that I didn't read the majority of these reviews before I booked my trip, or else I would have missed out on this good hotel. We stayed for 4 days at the end of May 2005 for our first trip to London. Our room was clean, and the staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel is about five minutes walk to lots of shopping and restaurants on Queensway. The Bayswater tube station is also about five minutes walk away, which can get you anywhere downtown, to the main attractions, to upper scale shopping and restaurants, and directly to Heathrow (will save a bunch on cab fare). Although Queensway was pretty loud during the night time, the hotel was always quiet all the time. Even though there were dozens and dozens of US university students on a class trip staying at the hotel while we were there, it was always quiet and pretty well organized. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet - breads, jams, eggs, juices, milk, cheese, cereal, etc. - better than the continental breakfasts at most US hotels. The tea was great. We spent very little time in the hotel after breakfast though - we were more interested in the attractions in London than in the hotel, which is likely what most budget-conscious people touring London are looking for. Also, there was plenty of hot water in the morning for a good shower with high water pressure - something I rather enjoyed. Overall, we really liked our stay, and we will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Factor50
Reviews.Content: The room was dark, stale-smelling and untidy ( curtains hanging off rail ) and there were NO tea/coffee making facilities at all in the room despite publicity stating that "every one of the 120 rooms has...." The room was in the basement and had a glass door leading straight outside ( a security and privacy risk in my view ) The bed was extremely uncomfortable, the television reception was poor Sound insulation was good, no noise from neighbours at all The shower and toilet were efficient but there were no drinking glasses provided at all ( for such esentials as rinsing after teeth-brushing ! ) Not a totally bad experience ( I've had much worse ) but a little effort had been spared and the lack of tea/coffee facilities ( in 2005 ) was unacceptable

Reviews.Title: “One only word: Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent some days last summer... London is a great city, but our holidays was completely ruined by this "3 stars hotel" ... what a joke!!.. i will rate this hotel less than 1 star! but unfortunately is not possible on tripadvisor. I've got problems on arrival in the evening (about 8:00 pm), they have reselled my booked room! ... and sent me for the first night to another hotel! a real 3 star hotel, absolutely better that pembridge palace hotel (it is not so difficult ... even a stable is better that this "hotel"). Rooms was really REALLY dirty with spider nets on the corners! i've noticed also writings on windows (written with DUST!!) asking the staff to clean !! :))) something like "please clean me" ridiculous. Bathroom was small and dirty my girlfriend refused to take a shower becouse from the upper floor there was a lost of water ... and bathroom lights becoming blinking ... both we thought that was very dangerous to mix water and electricity! nothing was happened thanks to god ... but NOT thanks to the staff !.. they told us that the hydrauilic maintenance was called but nobody has fixed our problem. Not a safe place! Lot of noise all night long .. coming from within the hotel becouse walls are very thin ... and you will able to hear people on others rooms breathing. Breakfast was very poor ... only bread with orange (only orage! bleah!) marmalade. The garden was unusable ... full of trash ... broken chairs, bycicles, boilers... I think that good reviews of this hotel on tripadvisor.com was made by the staff itself believe me ... it is not possible otherwise. I can only say for your health to NOT consider this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I almost cancelled my reservation after reading some of the reviews for this hotel but I am glad did not. I have used budget hotels in London about ten times in the last few years and found this to be the best for the price. The hotel is in a nice quiet square, the room was modern and clean and with buffet breakfast included. If there is better value in London W2 I have yet to find it.

Reviews.Title: “A good review”
Reviews.Author: Langerfeen
Reviews.Content: On reading some of the reviews of this hotel, I was genuinely worried that I was going to be staying in a dank pit where the overlord manager would sell me to slavery, not allowing me to sleep, eat properly, or, god forbid, watch television. However, when I got there, the only problem I encountered was that I arrived to early and wasnt allowed check in for another hour. When i did check in the staff were quick AND helpful. I suppose if you are ignorant to them, they will respond in kind! As for the room, well, it was small, but what are people expecting for what is a budget hotel. if you want a big spacious room, spend some more money please, and stop posting nonsense on the internet. The room was small, but clean. The bed was comfortable. The room was airy, but had a decent working radiator if it got cold. The bathroom was almost as big as the room, and had a nice powerful shower with hot water. The TVs reception wasnt great, but Ive yet to meet anyone who has travelled to London to watch TV, especially English TV! The breakfast was substandard, but thats purely down to my own tastes. There was plenty bread, fruit, juice, tea and coffee in a clean and well kept dining room. All in all, I cant fault the Pembridge Palace. Good price, good staff, nice rooms. Now if only everyone heeded the no smoking policy (for which there are numerous signs. Fire alarm at 6am isnt pleasent), it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Three stars (first class) rating for this hotel is an absolute joke. We expected little from London hotels as we've been there before and have been exposed to the prices and small rooms. This "Palace" takes the cake, however - TINY rooms, thin walls, below-average breakfast. For the price and the rating, you would expect half-way helpful staff. Our wake-up call the day of our 7 am departure never happened - and the manager had the audacity to be indignant and get mad at us for claiming he never called (what, all three of us in this tiny room went deaf?!). The night manager could not explain how we could make an overseas phone call. He convinced us to take a 35 lb taxi ride to Heathrow when the Heathrow Express would have been half the cost - turned out to be someone's private car. Do not expect 3-star service or 3-star accommodations - you will be sorry you stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible hotel in my life!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this horrible place! i spent one week in london booking with an agency this hotel... on arrival the first surprice... overbooking! 1 night triping in london :( ... we have changed rooms about 4 times ... becouse all of them was really dirty ... lots of dust everywere... sometimes with problems with toilets... very noisy because walls are very thin ... like paper! the bed was a kind of box with a small uncomfortable net, i've never seen things like that before :((... breakfast was really poor, without choose and if you get your breakfast after 9:00 am you will not find enything to eat!!! We payed to the agency about 50 punds x night!!!! a really theft. The only reason whe stayed here was because whe have payed in advance. Never again... EVEN FOR FREE!.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in late Feb.05”
Reviews.Author: Mabbelurius
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many a hotels in London before, and this, I think, was of the better. Yes, the rooms were tiny, but that's the same at most of these tourist hotels, and you usually don't spend too much time in the room anyways. Another minus was the fire alarm. There's no smoking in all rooms, so when people tried to light a cigarette dispite the rules, the alarm went off in the entire hotel. The staff just turned it off. In the end, I think this is a fire hazard in itself, because guests stop responding to the alarm. We just sit and wait for the staff to turn it off. Not good in case of a real fire. But the room was tidy and clean, had ovens which we could adjust ourselves, had a tv with five channels (though reception was so-so). The staff was kind enough. Breakfast was good. Buffet with bread, cereals, juices, milk, jam, coffee and tea. And the kitchen staff were very good at keeping the food coming. The maids were good also. They came in the room every day with fresh towels and tidied the beds. All in all, I had a nice stay at the Pembridge Palace, and I would recommend it to budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomadation in a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for four nights during Christmas and found it very feasible. The location is right in the heart of london with all the food and shops very near by. I do not understand why users are complaining about the staff; to me they were more than helpful. They allowed me an early check in and luggage leaving facility (after checkout) was also provided. The breakfast and its hours were very suitable too. The only thing which I found a bit below expectations was the size of the room;but that was very understandable keeping in mind the accomadation prices in london

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel for 4 days last November, and after reading all the reviews, I was really afraid of what we'd experience. But it was totally OK. We've stayed in the triple room on the 4th flour, northern side overlooking the street. The room was indeed small, but this is a very well known fact for most of low budget (and even not so low budget) hotels in London. The heating worked fine, the noise was not unbearable (the only annoying thing was that our room was just next to the swinging door in the hall and each person passing them made quite a loud BANG!). The sheets were stained a bit but they were fresh. The towels seemed to be clean but they did have a smell, as if they were stacked in a very damp place. I always use my own towels, so it didn't bother me that much. The bathroom was nice and clean, water was hot, we did have some problems closing the shower with wet hands, so the only way to close it was from outside after drying ourselves. Breakfast was good and sufficient, there was plenty of food even if we came down later towards the end of it. There was always warm toast or a toaster to heat - reheat it, eggs, cheese, ham, butter, jams, cereals and beverages. The staff is quite a problem, especially women in the breakfast room who don't speak english. But as much as we needed to contact any of the staff at the reception (which was actually only once when the key to the room didn't open the door), they were kind and they sorted the problem out. The location is good, there are two tube stations nearby (5 and 8 min walk) that cover 3 lines( two of which are Circle and Central, which are most useful to take you to the most important places of interest in the center). To summarize: The hotel is quite ok for a short stay in London, especially for the price you pay. If you don't expect much and if you come to London to enjoy the city and not to spend time at the hotel, then it's fine. Who cares about TV when there is so much to see and do in London!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible would be an understatement!”
Reviews.Author: Jezka
Reviews.Content: This was THE worst hotel I have ever stayed in! Their website says that they have recently renovated; but I just stayed there in Feb. of 2005 and there is nothing newly renovated in the place! The rooms are so tiny that you can barely move, the furniture looks like it was purchased at a garage sale 20 years ago, and (worst of all) the bed linens were filthy. We stayed there on two differnt occasions because it was a layover both coming and going to our final destination, but if we hadn't already reserved the room ahead of time I would have never stayed a second time. In both rooms the bed spreads we covered in stains and holes. The worst was in the second room where there appeared to be a large blood stain. Don't get me wrong, I wasn't expecting the Four Seasons (I have realistic expectations), but this hotel was beyond bad--it wasn't even sanitary!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “an open mind wouldnt make this any better...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this may be long-winded, but please take time to read this if you are ever going to visit this hotel. after our travel company overbooked, we were forced to stay at this hotel against our choice. Immediately I checked upon this site and I was shocked and appalled by the reviews. the best I could do was to go with an open mind, and i was still constantly disappointed. It took stepovers to reach the hotel on the tube (much more inconvenient that you might think) and even then it was quite a walk to the nearest station. upon arrival we were largely ignored by the staff, who infuriatingly simply stood and stared at us. after 45 minutes we had checked in, and our party were inexplicably spread across three floors (6 people for 3 rooms). The rooms were far smaller than I could have imagined. It was virtually impossible for two people to pass each other in the room. there was no room to place and / or unpack our cases, and anything of that sort meant taking up the bed. we decided to not unpack them because of this, yet on return to the hotel on the evening our cases had been opened and examined, and various garments and belongings strewn about the room. The bed was firm yet manageable, with irregular moleskin sheets that wreaked havoc with all of our parties skins. The sheets were very thin and no match for the winter cold. the pillows were unusually stained, and this seemed to be fresh. we decided to use our clothing as a pillow until they were cleaned - which never happened. Satellite TV was in fact 3 channels - BBC 1, 2 and ITV. wardrobe held 3 hangers and various rubbish bags and dirty linen. the shower was a simple fitting above a well used bathtub. once turned on, we fought for about 30 minutes to turn it off. we were lucky enough to have hot water in our room however. A bath of any sort was out of the question due to the lack of plugholes in the bathroom, which was coincidentally tiny. the Towels supplied were ragged around the ends, and had a terrible, sickening smell to them - they smelt as if not washed for a very long period, were damp and very dirty. (luckily i brought my own towel). The largest problem we found was that of the temperature - the heating in our room was non functional, and combined with a single glazed window leading onto a public park, coated with barbed wire and hotel rubbish, the room was constantly at a very low temperature. My mobile phone incorporates a thermometer, and at lowest point the room reached 2 degrees celcius. Sleeping in these conditions was unbearable. I attempted to complain numerous times, but the staff replied 'I will go and get the manager' and did not return. our party also had problems of the same nature, but that their room was too warm, and the heating would not turn down nor off. Breakfast was disgraceful. Only small amounts of food were supplied for a large amount of people, which soon ran out. Being first into the restaurant (which remained open for 2 hours per day) there were 10 slices of bread, one carton of tesco milk and 1 bowl of sugar. the staff made our stay unbearable - upon an attempt to purchase a soft drink, the staff stood and watched one of our party wait for about 15 minutes, finally coming out and being abusive to that person, stating that there is a supermarket about 10 minutes away, and that we should stop relying on the staff. upon checking out, most of us had numeric locks on our cases, as they were to be left behind the reception counter. as we returned to collect them, we found that attempts had been made to either decipher the code, and in some cases physically remove it. One case had been blatantly unpacked and repacked in a hurried fashion. Complaints were made but we were told that they had been left at our own risk. This hotel was like a scene from a bad movie - everything was wrong about it. I am in no way being melodramatic. I love London and i try to visit as much as I can, but because of this experience i may never go back. This was in fact a scary experience, as the staff had complete access to your belongings, and seemed to revel in the fact that they did. Please, please do not go to this hotel. It will ruin yor stay and you will be in constant unrest about what will come f your belongings and what will happen next

Reviews.Title: “don't”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although we're quite easy going about hotels, this wasn't what you should expect from a three star hotel! It wasn't clean, the bed was awful (even for England). It was noisy. The breakfast buffet didn't look like a buffet and they'd better can't serve breakfast anymore! The location isn't so good too. It's quite a walk to the tube, and to get into the center of the city you must step over on tube. So, I would say: don't go there!

HotelInfo.Name: Pembridge Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 55 Prince's Square, London W2 4PX, England
